loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti operates a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. The previous loan helped her to boost her business and now it is growing. However, she faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a single woman who has one child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a general shop, where she sells a variety of goods. Betty has been involved in this business for three years. She will use the KES10,000 loan to purchase additional stock to expand her business. 

She hopes that in the future her business will excel.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gas as well as food products such as rice, sugar and powdered milk to stock his shop and resell.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is 42 years old and married with three children.

Alfonsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, sugar, chocolate drink, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drink, etc. to sell.

Alfonsa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Alfonsa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, sugar, chocolate drink, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drink, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothes, cologne, bathroom cleanser and pillows to sell.

loans.name: Mame Anta

texts.fr: Mame Anta est une femme âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans le commerce de friperies depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a démarré avec une minime somme de 35 000f en achetant une balle de bébé pour essayer et cela lui a rapporté un bénéfice de 13 000F. Elle a continué petit à petit et actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acquérir deux fois plus voire trois fois que la première fois de marchandises. Mame Anta appuie son époux dans les charges de la maison et la dépense quotidienne. Elle a comme projet, d’ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de friperies et d’y associer la vente de chaussures.
texts.en: Mame Anta is 51 years old, married, and the mother of a family.  For over ten years, she has been actively involved in selling used clothing.  She started in this business with a very small amount of money (35,000 CFA francs) and first bought a bail of baby clothes with which she made a profit of 13,000 CFA francs.  She gradually grew her business, and she is now requesting a loan which will allow her to buy twice as much, or even three times as much merchandise than the first time.  Mame Anta helps her husband to cover the daily expenses of the household.  In the future, she would like to open a large used clothes store and to also start selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from four years to 18 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a food stall where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are local. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of fish to expand the business. Her goal is to use the profits from her expansion to diversify her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of coconuts for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Felisa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a borrower who is 23 years old and unmarried. He is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He has been in the motorcycle (bodaboda) transport business for five years. 

Stephen has a motorcycle and he wants to buy another one to increase his income, which will improve the standard of living for his family. He also wants to help pay for his younger brothers to acquire a good education so they can find better employment opportunities and live a better life. 

He thanks Kiva through UGAFODE for helping him take another step to success. In the photo is Stephen with the UGAFODE credit officer and the motorcycle Stephen wants to buy.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jeff Dieul De Darou Pacathiaré Group

texts.fr:
Un groupement mixte appelé « Jeff Dieul Darou Pacathiaré » regroupe des hommes qui font l’embouche. Saliou, le responsable moral a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce milieu. Il a hérité l’activité de son père qui possédait un troupeau de bœufs. Depuis lors, il veut renforcer un à deux vœux avec le crédit sollicité. Il pourra alors améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille, payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
Dans l’avenir, il veut chercher un terrain et cultiver du mil, du mais de l’arachide.
texts.en: This two-person group, called « Jeff Dieul Darou Pacathiaré », gathers men who are involved in cattle fattening.  Saliou, the group's representative, has more than ten years of experience in this field of work.  He inherited his father's business, as his father used to own a herd of cattle.  He is now requesting a loan in order to increase his herd through the purchase of one or two cows.  He will then be able to improve his family's food conditions and pay for his children's school fees.  In the future, he is planning to acquire a plot of land on which he will grow millet, maize and groundnut.

loans.use: to buy some cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Gpf Keur Safadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe appelé Keur Safadi 3 regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture. La dame Diama qui est la plus forte sur la photo, fait de la culture maraichère de choux, carottes aubergine. Elle possède un espace derrière la maison où elle loge et profite de ce crédit pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais. Les bénéfices de la vente sont destinés à aider à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Diama désire associer la vente de produits cosmétiques à son activité, elle donnera à sa fille qui le gérera. Cela permettra de maximiser les profits et d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en: The "Keur Safadi 3" group consists of two women who are actively involved in agriculture.  Diama, the tallest woman in the photo, grows cabbage, carrots and eggplants.  She owns a piece of land behind the house where she lives, and she will use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  The profits from the sale of her garden vegetables will be used to help her husband cover the day-to-day expenses of the household.  In addition to her farming activity, Diama would also like to sell cosmetic products.  She would actually give this activity to her daughter who would run it.  This will allow her to maximize her profits and to improve her family's food conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Darou Mbitéyène 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le regroupement Darou Mbitéyène 4 rassemble cinq femmes toutes actives. Elles habitent le même quartier et se réunissent une fois par mois pour discuter, échanger et verser l’argent emprunté. Leur responsable, la dame Khady,qui est la première à droite de la photo, s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 5 ans (elle est habillée en rouge sur la photo). Khady va acheter des semences et de l’engrais avec le crédit sollicité et va cultiver ou aider son mari dans les champs. 
Son vœu le plus cher est d’acquérir sa propre maison.
texts.en: The "Darou Mbitéyène 4" group consists of five very active women.  They live in the same neighborhood and meet once a month to discuss, share and repay their loans.  The group's representative, Khady, has been actively involved in agriculture for more than five years (in the photo, she is standing on the right-hand side and dressed in red).  Khady will use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers and will cultivate or help her husband in the fields.  Her dearest wish is to own a house one day.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more women's wrap clothes (lessos) for her business

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Besides the retail shop business, Luvuno operates a charcoal-selling business. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of charcoal for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alassane est un jeune de 25 ans, marié, qui évolue dans le commerce de cartes téléphoniques rechargeables. Il a une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine. Il ne détient pas de cantine, mais fait le marchand ambulant à travers la ville. Alassane vient solliciter ce crédit pour acheter des cartes rechargeables : réseaux orange, tigo, expresso… qui existent au Sénégal. Le bénéfice unitaire sur la vente de carte étant très faible, Alassane joue sur la quantité à vendre pour maximiser son profit. Il s’occupe de sa petite famille et de leurs besoins au quotidien.
Alassane désire un jour avoir les moyens pour ouvrir une boutique de ventes de cartes, mais aussi de téléphones portables et accessoires.
texts.en: Alassane is 25 years old and married. He sells rechargeable phone cards, and he has a five-year experience in this field.  He does not have a stall but works as an itinerant seller, all over town.  He is requesting this loan in order to buy rechargeable phone cards from providers such as Orange, Tigo, Expresso, all present in Senegal.  Since the profit he makes by selling one rechargeable card is very small, Alassane is planning to buy bulk quantities in order to maximize his profits.  He takes care of his young family and of their daily needs.  Alassane would like to have the means to open a shop one day, and would like to sell not only phone cards but also mobile phones and accessories.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 45 years old and has seven children. Jacqueline is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Jacqueline is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Jacqueline requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jacqueline has been farming corn for 6 years now, and she has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jacqueline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edras Isai

texts.es:
Edras, ha mejorado su negocio con ayuda de créditos por lo que nuevamente se decidió a solicitar más capital para renovar el inventario de la venta de ropa, comprara faldas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa interior, entre otras prendas variadas en estilos, colores y tallas, con lo restante surtirá en la mini tienda que ha logrado establecer comprara arroz, frijoles, golosinas, pan, aceite, jabón, huevos, etc., 
La inversión anterior le permitió mantenerse trabajando y generando ingresos con los que ha dado a su familia lo necesario para tener una vida más confortable y mantener su buen record crediticio.
texts.en: Edras has improved his business with the help of loans. That is why he has decided to ask for more capital again to renew the inventory of the clothes he sells. He will buy skirts, shirts, pants, dresses, underwear, and other items of clothing in different styles, colors and sizes. With the rest, he will stock the mini-store that he has been able to open. He will buy rice, beans, snacks, bread, oil, soap, eggs, etc. The previous loan allowed him to keep working and generating income to give his family what they need to have a more comfortable life, as well as maintain his good credit history.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, pants, dresses, underwear, rice, beans, snacks, bread, oil, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 26 years old and is a garment worker. He lives with his mother in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He can earn approximately $4 per day.

Now he would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to renovate his house and some for his mother to buy corn to boil to resell. This loan will help him and his mother have a better home and business. In the future, he is going to expand his mother’s selling business and fill under his house with soil to avoid flooding.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is 44 years old. She is married and bringing up 3 children. Her husband is a welder.

10 years ago, Mavjuda began her own business sewing and selling clothes. She sews school uniforms, robes and women's dresses. She buys fabrics and other sewing items in the market which is located in the capital of Tajikistan. Mavjuda sews clothes in her house.

Now, it is a season for sewing and selling school uniforms. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy fabrics for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, 58 years of age, is married and they're blessed with five children.

She has managed a hog raising business for almost five years and earns a net income of 5,000 PHP every four months. She's also into a tailoring business for additional income.

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to improve.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, ha seguido elaborando la venta de comida con la materia prima que compro con el financiamiento anterior, sus ingresos le sirven para dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
Con el fin de tener su negocio funcionando opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar gas propano, carnes, embutidos, pollo, bebidas, verduras, condimentos y reparara la cocina industrial, lo que le servirá para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
María has continued to make and sell food with the raw materials she bought with the previous loan. She uses her income to give her family better food, clothes and health. 

In order to keep her business working she has decided on a new loan to buy propane gas, meat, deli meats, chicken, beverages, vegetables, seasonings, as well as to repair the industrial stove. This will allow her to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, meat, deli meats, chicken, beverages, vegetables, seasonings, as well as to repair the industrial stove.

loans.name: Mileidi

texts.es:
Mileidi es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Mileidi y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.
Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.
Solicita un préstamo para adecuar un espacio que tiene en su casa como especie de bodega y poder tener sus productos bien organizados.
Esto le permitirá atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera y aumentara sus ventas de una manera significativa.
Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Mileidi is a very entrepreneurial young woman who really wants to get ahead and progress. For four years she has been selling products via catalog such as clothing, accessories, beauty items and home products. She sells mainly to friends, neighbors and relatives who know Mileidi and also want her to progress in her activity. Since she was very young she has really liked business and sales, so today she has great ability in this field thanks to her kindness and the excellent quality of service.  

She is asking for a loan to set up a space she has in her house as a storage space for her products so she can keep them well organized. This will allow her to serve her customers in a better way and increase her sales significantly. She hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the support of good hearted people who help with this type of projects.

loans.use: to set up a space in her house as a storage space for her products.

loans.name: Zharkin

texts.en:
Zharkin is a kind woman who has been busy with animal husbandry. Zharkin was born in the year 1962. She is married, and brings up a daughter. 

Ten years ago, Zharkin began a business with animal husbandry. She feeds two cows now. Zharkin sells milk and milk products to local people. 

She is going to increase her working capital, and in this way increase business. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a milk cow. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
From the Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, Sarim, 36, is an experienced and industrious farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 4 a day to support her family daily needs. She is a lovely mother of two unmarried children who are enrolling in the local school.

To accelerate her farming process, Sarim would like to get cows to help her for plowing the farm land, yet she can’t afford them. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan from HKL, since it has a low interest rate.  

She also thanks to all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 54 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Josefina has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load (prepaid mobile phone credits) retailing.  Josefina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Josephine

texts.en:
Ma. Josephine is 43 years old, married, and she has five children. Three of them are currently in school.

Ma. Josephine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, beers, cereals, and other items to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, beer and cereal.

Lilibeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, beers, cereals, and other items to sell

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
This is Zuhura. She works hard every day to improve her living standards.She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase more household consumables such as wheat flour, beans, sugar and rice for her business.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more household consumables such as wheat flour, beans, sugar and rice for her business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 33-year-old married woman from Ratevani village. She is the mother of an infant son and school-aged daughter. Nino’s husband has a state job and generates a fixed salary.

Nino doesn’t have any stable activity, but she works hard seasonally on her agricultural activities. She harvests various kinds of vegetables and uses them for local trading. In order to increase her productivity and generate more income, Nino has started trading with grocery products. She has opened a mini-store near her house and start selling products among her villagers. Her project is profitable, but it needs support for further development.

She needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to continue running her new business. Nino has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Nino and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase working materials and open grocery store

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela, who is a 41-year-old single woman, lives in the Samtredia district. She lives with her sister’s family. The only employed person in their family is her sister’s husband, who works as a private artisan and generates some income. Natela has great desire somehow to do her bit for the family’s welfare, and start her own activity. 

She couldn't receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or a stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product between Kiva and Credo. The program allows poor people like Natela to get a chance to start or re-start a business.

With the requested amount of money, Natela plans to go to Turkey, purchase clothing at wholesale prices, and sell in her region at increased prices. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person, with a great desire to give help to her family. 

Natela is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Muafaka-Group

texts.en:
Martin is a businessman, purchasing and selling local tobacco to big buyers, a business he has been in for eight years. He is married and has four sons and two daughters who are still at school. He works hard so as to improve his family life, taking his small kids to a better private school. He works from 7am to evening each working day, moving from one farmer to another to purchase stock. 

Despite his hard work and sometimes selling at low prices (price discrimination from big buyers), he makes a small profit each month. In order to be able to sell his stock at a good price, Martin requires enough capital to be able to own a truck and a good/modern storage place. With that, he can defend against tobacco diseases and against 'big fish' who force him to sell at a very low price because there is no option. He found himself expensive and traveling far to transport his stock to the cigarette industry. He dreams that one day he will be able to expand his business so as to maximize his income and afford a better life for his family. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his second loan which he will use to buy stocks of local tobacco to resell. He used the previous credit, repaid successfully, to buy extra sacks of business stock than before. He managed to resell and received profits which, as a father, he used to cover school fees and home food expenses. He will share this loan with his group, "MUAFAKA", which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of local tobacco to resell.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a divorced woman, and blessed with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mealii has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gents suits for sale at home. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing tread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing tread for her business.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 27-year-old married man. He has a child who is 2 years old. He describes himself as honest. He operates a boda boda transport service. He describes his biggest business challenge to be security. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase an additional motorbike to expand his business. He hopes that in the future he can raise the standard of living for his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase an additional motorbike to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a cattle shed

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 10 children. She describes herself to be kind and hardworking. 

Julia operates a fish business. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock and renovate the stall. Her business goal is to grow into a larger fish stall within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock and renovate the stall

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Selly, 37 years of age, a very hardworking, loving person, and someone who cherishes her family so much. Selly is married, and she has six adorable children that she really loves; whenever she comes home you will notice a pleasant feeling among the family members. 

Selly has gathered so much experience through mixed farming, because she has been doing it for the past 16 years. She is considered as one of the most hardworking farmers in her village, and she has gained so much respect. Through cattle and crop farming she has been able to take care of her family, but Selly wants to diversify and keep poultry so that she can make ends meet and also pull more resources together. 

Due to increased living conditions Selly has been struggling to feed her large family - that is why she came up with a plan to start poultry farming and supplement her income. 

Through a loan of KES 60,000, Selly is sure that she will be able to make her dream come to a reality by buying poultry and starting poultry farming. 

Poultry farming has so many advantages, and apart from egg-selling, Selly will have manure to use on her farm, and therefore not incur the costs of buying manure. Through cutting costs she will be able to save more money and provide a secure and bright future for her children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Nramoyo

texts.en:
Nramoyo is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school and two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nramoyo operated a food making business, making constables like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income, and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Africa Grp Group

texts.en:
Anisenty, a father of seven schooling children, five sons and two daughters, is in his 40's. Currently he runs a business selling cereals (corns,beans, sometime Irish potatoes). He has been in this business for ten good years now. Anisenty works from 07 am to 06 pm daily, and is able to earn a fair monthly profit. 

This is his first loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy cereals from harvesting regions to sell. The loan will be apportioned among AFRICA, a five-member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

He dreams of expanding his business to maximize income.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailor shop. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock of materials to expand the business. Her business goal is to own a fully independent boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of materials to expand the business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 26-year-old single woman. She has a child who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase additional stock to improve her business. Her business goal is to have a boutique within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to improve her business.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is 44 years old and has five children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Macaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Macaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yonah

texts.en:
WONDERFUL LENDERS! Meet Yonah, 37 years of age and a very hardworking, honest and humble man who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area than never lacks rainfall and is blessed by good climatic conditions. Being raised from a humble background, Yonah practices a lot of humility. His parents taught him to be very hardworking so that he can make it in life. Through hard work he has practiced farming for the past 4 years and has been able to care for the needs of his family. 

Yonah also practices tree farming. He has many trees on his farm that are ready for harvesting, but he faces the challenge of cutting them down. He has been using crude methods to cut down the trees, such as using machetes or “panga” and ropes which is very time consuming. That is why he is asking for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a power saw to help him cut down trees fast with less energy and time. Through the loan Yonah will be able to sell more timber to his neighbors and the markets around, because Kitale is still developing and more people are building houses. This means that timber has a ready market. 

Being a very hardworking man and someone who really values education, he wants to give his children the best education he can, because this is the only “key to success”. Profits from selling timber will be used to pay back the loan and to hire other employees to work for him in supplying and cutting down trees, hence impacting the society positively.

Yonah plans to open a very big timber yard where people will be coming to buy timber and posts of all sizes, hence generating more income.

loans.use: To buy a power saw.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil and maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sweets, cooking oil and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 48-year-old single mother with three children, all of whom are school-going. She is borrowing 500,000 UGX for the purpose of buying bananas to sell. She hopes this will boost her business and increase her profits. She sells sweet bananas at a food market on the city outskirts. Fatima is so grateful for UGAFODE services and she hopes to borrow more money from the institution so as to improve on her income. She is an honest lady and God-fearing.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en: Kache is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She is asking for a loan to purchase more items for resale, such as sugar, wheat flour and salt. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase more items for resale, such as sugar, wheat flour and salt.

loans.name: Ley

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Ley, 37, is an experienced and industrious farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 4 a day to support her family's daily expenses. She is a lovely mother of three schoolchildren who are enrolled in the primary school.

To keep her rice growing well and provide more benefit, Ley wants to use some natural fertilizers. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a KIVA loan to buy fertilizers. She hopes that this loan will help her rice to grow well and also bring her more fruitful profits. She says thanks to all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is a 26-year-old young woman from the village of Tobanieri. She is the mother of a kindergarten-aged son and daughter, and she also has a husband, mother-in-law and grandmother. The family earns a living with agricultural activities. In particular, Shorena and her husband are extensively engaged in cattle and cow breeding, in beekeeping, in cultivating a plot of agricultural land and in growing nuts. They use the products for local trading. Shorena is a hardworker who supports her beloved husband in making a living for their precious family and covering their increasing needs and daily expenses. 

In order to increase her income, Shorena decided to start a clothing trading business. She plans to purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices and then sell among her friends and villagers at increased prices. This loan will be great support to this hardworking woman and her family. Shorena will be grateful to lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income and also to make savings for her children’s better life.

loans.use: To start a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 25-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 8 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a boda boda transport service. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft and security. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle to expand his business. He hopes that in the future, he may use the profits from his business to purchase a dairy cow for his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 22 years old. She is married to Joseph and together they have been blessed with two children of 9 and 4 years respectively.

Esther runs a business selling vegetables and fruits as well as charcoal. She has done this business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 12,000. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, of Kshs. 30,000, which she will use to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

She will use the anticipated profits earned to educate her children as well as to improve the living standards of her family.

Esther's hopes and dreams are to have improved standards of living as well as to bring her business to higher levels.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Mouin

texts.en:
Mouin is a 47-year-old married Palestinian Refugee and a father of five, who has been working in the scrap trade for thirteen years. He lives and works in a Palestinian camp, where the working sector is very limited. He is a hard worker who puts so much effort in developing his family's living through increasing his business capital and developing it properly. 

He used to work at doing body work on cars, but he realized that this business (selling scrap) is more profitable for covering his increasing family needs. Today, he is acquiring his fourth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise in order to increase his income and develop his family's living. Mouin hopes that one day he can open a shop outside the camp and expand his working sector.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise in order increase his income and improve his family's life.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 51 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Belinda is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos van a la escuela del cantón. El cliente trabaja la agricultura desde hace muchos años y también trabaja la albañilería. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz. 

Juan planea construir una mejor casa para que su familia tenga una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and studied up to 9th grade. He is married; his wife is a homemaker. He has 3 children, 2 of whom go to the region’s school. The client has worked in agriculture for many years and also works in construction. 
He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his corn crop. 
Juan plans to build a better house so that his family can have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus is an entrepreneur who runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. He's married and living in East Bandung in a house consisting of five family members. 

Agus began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, Agus hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita lives in Sukabumi, a city in West Java located about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. She runs a small stall selling mobile phones, mobile phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Anita is married and she runs the stall together with her husband. 

She began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Anita is standing in her small stall with her husband.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita and her husband live in north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. 

She runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits. Lita's husband is a factory worker. 

She began working with Ruma a month ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends. 

In the photo, Lita is standing in front of her stall.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 39-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailor shop where he sells kitenge (traditional fabric) materials and makes dresses. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the seasons. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He hopes that in the future, he may use the profits from his business to purchase a dairy cow for his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to expand his business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 31 years old. She is married to Aggrey, and together, they have been blessed with three children of 11, 9 and 4 years respectively. 

Agnes runs a beauty salon, a business she has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). Agnes has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 15,000 KES, which she will use to purchase beauty products like relaxers, hair shampoo and conditioners and hair oils.

Agnes will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business in her salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 32-year-old married man with three children between the ages of one to six. For the past five years, he has operated a tailoring shop where he sells materials and makes clothing. David describes himself as visionary. His biggest business challenge is seasonality. 

David is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase additional stock of materials to expand his business. This will be his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. David hopes to use the profit from his business to purchase a dairy cow for his family in the future.

loans.use: to material to expand his business

loans.name: Ngiranze Group

texts.fr:
Sabin  fait partie du groupe  Ngiranze et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 44 ans et est marié à  Claudine, une commerçante. 

Il fait le commerce   de riz depuis 4 ans.  

C’est son premier  crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande quantité de riz    à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un commerçant  grossiste de riz et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Sabin belongs to the Ngiranze group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 44 years old and married to Claudine, who is a trader.

He has been buying and selling rice for the past four years and this is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice to resell, so that he can earn more money.

In the coming years he would like to become a wholesale trader of rice and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice to resell, so that he can make more money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more clothing

loans.name: Parbbati

texts.en:
Parbbati, 42 years old, lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in a small village Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has an education till grade 8. Their daughter is a student of grade 8. Due to poverty, they were unable to give higher education to their son, and now he works as a labourer on daily wages.

Parbbati is a homemaker who looks after her children and manages household works. Her husband, 46-year-old Samaru, makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing potatoes and different types of gourds. He has many years of experience in this field and has valuable experience that allows him to get the best harvest. He sells his produce in all the nearby areas and has a lot of steady customers who always prefer his products because of the quality, affordable prices and incomparable service.

Parbbati's land is located in an agricultural area where the climate and soil are suitable for tea cultivation. So in order to expand his agribusiness, her husband wants to cultivate tea plants besides farming other vegetables. He wants to buy agricultural inputs, but he needs capital.

Parbbati is asking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers, tools, pest control, etc. She trusts that with the help of the loan, they will be able to cultivate tea in abundance and it will be a profitable business that will provide her family the life they deserve.

She thanks her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs to cultivate tea plants.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti and her husband live in north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. 

While her husband works in a private company, she runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits. 

She began working with Ruma a month ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Bahtiniso

texts.en:
Bahtiniso is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has two children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. They have two little children and must comfort them with all the modern conveniences.  

Bahtiniso four years ago began her own business in sewing national women's dresses. She has her own workshop in the center of her town. Thanks to the good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. 

She wants to develop her business further, but she needs to buy an embroidery machine. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine for increasing her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan is 57 years old, a farmer and a widow with three children. Two of her children are garment workers. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to buy bricks and wood to build a new kitchen. This loan will help her have a new kitchen for living in a better condition. In the future, she is going to keep her rice farming going.

loans.use: to buy bricks and wood to build a new kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various fresh food products.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Cheikh, est un jeune de 21 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de cartes téléphoniques rechargeables depuis 2 ans. Il a démarré avec l’appui de son père et avec ses propres économies. Il est marié et n’a pas encore d’enfants, sa femme vit avec ses parents dans la grande famille ; il donne une participation mensuelle pour la nourriture.
Voulant renforcer son capital, il sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de cartes des réseaux orange, tigo et expresso. Comme projet futur, il veut agrandir son commerce et diversifier les produits et services par exemple, vendre en même temps des téléphones portables et fixes.
texts.en: Cheikh is a 21-year old man who has been buying and selling rechargeable telephone cards for the past two years. He began with the help of his father and his own savings. He is married but does not yet have children; his wife lives with her family in a large family and he makes a monthly contribution for food. He would like to boost his capital and is thus requesting a loan to buy Orange, Tigo and Expresso network cards. His future plans are to expand his business and diversify both his products and services, by selling portable and landline telephones for example.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, age 34, runs a general store business where he sells such items as sugar, salt, bread, and soap.  He describes himself to be a visionary, but reports that his business is hampered by a poor road network. 

Patrick and his wife have three children between the ages of two and 10 years old.

He has requested a loan in the amount of Kes 20,000 in order to purchase an additional stock of rice and baking flour to offer for sale in his store. He hopes that in the future, he may use the profits from his business to build a permanent house for his family, and to raise their standard of living. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase rice and baking flour to offer for sale in his store

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 57 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with five children. Benjamin has managed a farming business in his village for the past 38 years and he earned a net income of 42,000 PHP from his last harvest. He usually spends his income to cover his family’s daily expenses and to cover his children’s school fees.

Benjamin is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to sell. In the future, he hopes that his farm will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to sell

loans.name: Amelina

texts.en:
Amelina is 47 years old and married with two children; both are in school. Amelina works very hard to provide for them.

Amelina's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Amelina has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Amelina has taken a 8166.60 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Amelina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 47 years old and married with three children. 

Epefania is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Epefania requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Epefania has been in pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Epefania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a 44-year-old woman and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). She is from a small village of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. She lives there with her husband and her children. They send their children to school, and now they are in grade 10 and grade 9. In her childhood she did not get the opportunity to get education due to the poor financial resources of her parents, so she is earnestly trying to provide education to her children.

Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates different vegetables in his farm land in different seasons and sells them to the market. Amena assists her husband in field work after managing her household work. With several years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way, including rising costs of inputs and the instability of the prices for buying and selling vegetables.
 
Now that her children have grown up and the family expenses are increasing day by day, they feel the need to further improve their agricultural activities.  They have decided to cultivate paddy rice, which is an all-season crop. Being the staple food of West Bengal, it is in demand throughout the year.  So they think it will be a profitable businesses that will generate income.

Currently, Amena is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers etc. to start cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hope of getting ahead because her household expenses depend on this work.

Her dream as a mother is to give good education to her children, so they can prosper in life. 

With her profits she plans to purchase more land in the future. 

She conveys her thanks to her lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Miriam, a 30-year-old mother who is very kind, loving and charming. Miriam hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and one of the best places to do farming in the world. The climatic conditions in this area favor farming and Miriam, being a hard working mother, has taken full advantage of that. Miriam is blessed with four children and she refers to them as “her pride” and she takes good care of them since they are the source of her happiness. 

Miriam has been doing farming for the past six years and since she ventured into farming she has always made tremendous strides in terms of profit margins. Through practicing mixed farming (that is, crop and animal farming) she has been able to support her family and provide for them the basic necessities in life. Although Miriam has been making profits through farming the income is not enough to fully support her family. Consequently, she has been having a dream of starting a poultry business. The main challenge that Miriam is facing is getting her business off the ground. Therefore she is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to be able to start a poultry farming busines. Through the loan Miriam will be able to comfortably take care of her family and assure her children and  grandchildren of a secure future. 

Miriam is very hard working and she is sure that she can turn around the loan into one of the best business enterprises and be able to employ more people to assist in the farm work. Being a mother in Africa Is very challenging and accessing financial solutions is hard but through your loan Miriam is sure that you will be able to “transform the lives of small scale holders by providing financial solutions”. Miriam plans to buy more poultry once the business has picked up and be able to repay the loan through the profits she will be getting. Increased profits will make her business flourish and hence provide a secure solid education system to her children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita lives in a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 24 years old and a housewife. She lives with her two children (one son and one daughter) and her husband, Karnak (age 30 years), who is a farmer. Anita and her husband have primary educations. Their one child goes to school and the other is too small to go to school. They have a small kachha house (mud, wood and straw made).

Anita’s husband has a farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. He is visionary and focused man. He has been involved in this business for many years. He struggles hard to grow quality vegetables to satisfy his customers. His land is very fertile and productive. Anita, though a housewife, helps her husband in sowing, planting and carrying the produce to the market. 

They need to expand their business in order to cope with the increasing expenses of their family, but their main challenge is capital.

So Anita has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to cultivate bitter gourd in their farmland. She wants to use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs to start the cultivation.

Her goals are to strengthen their family economy and provide better education to her children so that they become professional in the future.

She and her husband are thankful to the lenders for helping her by giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of bitter gourd.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is 50 years old and a widow from Rustavi District. She has only one son who works in security services and earns 300 GEL monthly. Luiza’s existing income is not enough to cover even her basic needs. She was unable to find a job and decided to start her own agricultural business selling eggs. All the financial institutions rejected her loan request because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Luiza applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved within the framework of the Start Up program, a joint initiative with Kiva that permits poor people to start or re-start businesses. 

Luiza is requesting a loan to purchase chickens. She will start selling eggs locally at a competitive price. Luiza hopes to be capable of expanding her agribusiness in the future and sell various kinds of products. She awaits your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and start a poultry farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of timber.

loans.name: Lkucy

texts.en:
Lkucy is a 25-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailor shop where she sells materials and makes dresses. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase a sewing machine. Her goal is to expand her business to be the best within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to raise the standard of living for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: And Liggey De Ndiotté Mor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit And Liggey de Ndiotte Mor regroupe une famille composée du père, de la mère et des trois enfants qui s’activent dans l’agriculture. Ils possèdent un champ familial qu’ils exploitent toujours ensemble. Le père de famille est le responsable du groupe, il s’appelle Mapathé, âgé de 70 ans. Le crédit leur servira à acheter des intrants, des semences et de l’engrais pour cultiver leur champ en commun. L’agriculture est la principale source de revenus de la famille.
Monsieur Mapathé veut créer une entreprise familiale, et diversifier les activités génératrices de revenus pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
The And Ligge de Ndiotte Mor loan group is made up of a family: father, mother and three children, who are all active farmers. The own a family field which they still farm together. The father, who is called Mapathé, is responsible for the group and is 70 years old. The loan will be used to buy inputs, seeds and fertilizer for farming their common field. Farming is the principal source of income for the family.  

Mapathé would like to create a family business and diversify its income-generating activites to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and married with two children. For the past ten years, she has operated a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Elizabeth also earns additional income from renting computer gaming machines.

Elizabeth is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.

She earns a living through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Carmencita has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from abaca weaving.

Carmencita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 21 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like canned goods, coffee, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell.

Gina has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, coffee, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en: Philomene is 49 years old. She is married with five children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analisa is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Analisa's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Analisa is taking out a 9,800 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Analisa has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Analisa would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet James, one of the most hardworking men on earth. He is ambitious and 29 years of age. James hails from Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is called the “bread basket” of Kenya since half of the food that Kenya consumes is from that area. 

James has been doing farming for the past 10 years and he has gathered immense wealth of experience through all those years. Because of the experience that he has, he offers free advice to young farmers who want to start farming and also extension services to his neighbors. 

James practices mixed farming and through these ventures he has been able to reap more profits but has not reached the maximum. 

James sells vegetables and milk to the nearby market that is far from where he lives, and he has been experiencing a challenge in transporting the products to the market. James' village is very remote and there is poor infrastructure and roads are very poor and this has been a challenge to James because products from his farm reach the market very late when they are not fresh, hence fetching a low price.

James deals with perishable goods and therefore he needs to deliver them to the market as quickly as possible. That is why he is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to purchase a motorbike that will assist him in delivering the products quickly to the market. 

James is sure that through timely delivery of products he will reap maximum profits and he will be able to support his two children and his family. 

James dream is to continue cultivating his land and selling more produce to the market so that his family does not lack anything. Through profits gathered he will pay back the loan on time and secure the future of his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Aracelly De Jesus

texts.es:
Aracelly ha tenido que soportar el duro verdugo del desplazamiento a causa de la violencia, ella vivía en San Carlos y se vio en la obligación de trasladarse hasta Medellín en busca de una nueva oportunidad de vida para ella y sus hijos lejos de la violencia, la sangre y las balas.
Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa en la cual se gana la vida vendiendo helados caseros y minutos a celular, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vitrina-enfriador y surtido de otro tipo de helados.
Con este préstamo para ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.
Hoy en día es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Aracelly had to survive the hardship of displacement caused by violence. She lived in San Carlos and she was forced to move to Medellin in search of a new lease on life for her and her kids far away from the violence, the blood and the bullets.

Today she lives in a humble home where she makes a living selling homemade ice cream and cell phone minutes, an activity that she learned empirically in an effort to bring sustenance to her children. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of a refrigerated display case and a variety of other ice creams. 

With this loan she will offer a better variety of products and will considerably improve her sales.

She is a strong woman with a great entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case and an assortment of ice creams.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Jetmir

texts.en:
Jetmir, age 21, keeps cows to earn a living. He has two milk cows and a calf. He raises calves from their infancy until it is time for them to be sold. He uses the milk products from his milk cows to sustain his family as well as to sell at market.

He and his wife have a one-year-old son.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to renovate his stable, which he cannot presently afford to do on his own. 

He wants to thank all of his lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate his stable

loans.name: Yuvenalis

texts.en:
Yuvenalis is a married man. He has five children. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for sale. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. His business goal is to open a hotel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big hotel. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Gie Keur Safadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Keur Safadi 5, rassemble deux braves femmes qui se sont constituées en groupe d’intérêt économiques pour exercer leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le développement et la légalité. La principale activité est l’agriculture. La dame Coumba (à la gauche sur la photo) est la responsable, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle possède un champ de manioc et l’argent lui servira à acheter de l’engrais, des pesticides et les semences. 
Coumba appuie son mari dans la gestion du foyer. Elle aimerait un jour diversifier et faire de la culture maraichère.
texts.en: The Keur Safadi 5 group is made up of two good honest women who have set up a GIE (groupe d'intérêt économique - an economic interest group) so that they can legally conduct their developing income-generating activities. Their principal activity is farming. The woman, Coumba (on the left of the photo), is the one who is responsible for the group. She is married and mother to four children. She owns a cassava field and the money will enable her to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds. Coumba helps her husband with the household expenses; She would like to diversify her activities one day and do market gardening.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old and married with two children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Julieta has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Julieta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise to increase his sales.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 54-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. Maryam has expertise in tailoring and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 10 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community for her tailoring service. 

Now, she has requested another loan worth 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase a new sewing machine, along with some spools of threads. She says that the females of her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge. She is positive that the loan will help to increase her output.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, along with some spools of threads

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: At 47 years of age, Nasreen is running a small general store very close to her house. She has been handling this store for the past 5 years with the assistance of her husband. Her shop is situated in the middle of her town and a sufficiently large number of customers visit it every day. She is doing quite well and has a number of repeat customers. She is in her 6th loan cycle, and has successfully returned her previous loans on time. Now, Nasreen has requested a loan amount of 50,000 PKR with which she intends to purchase stock of soaps, shampoos, hair oils, toothpastes, eatables, etc. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her 4 children through all her hard work and efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of soaps, shampoos, hair oils, toothpastes, eatables, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 37 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives together with her family in the village of one of the minority communities. Her husband is employed as a driver and she is a housewife taking care of the house.  

Her house is very old and needs renovation urgently in order to live a healthy life. Her house windows and doors are very old and she has not been able to afford replacements with his salary. For the first time, Valentina is requesting a loan to change the doors and windows. The loan will contribute to her having better living conditions. She really appreciates this help and and gives thanks for all this support.

loans.use: To change doors and windows

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.fr: Bitashengwa est une commerçante depuis 2 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires «Sanai», entrepreneur,  dynamique, âgée de 26 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 étudient et 1 encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des divers produits manufacturés. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise.Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un cambiste. Elle va acheter  des savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, cartons de bombons, des biscuits, sucre, riz, huiles, sel iodé etc. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique. Il sied de signaler, qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Bitashengwa has been a trader for the past two years and is a member of the Sanai business association; she is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 26 years old, married and mother to three children, two of whom are studying and the third who is still a small child. She sells a variety of manufactured goods and is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She began it with funds from her husband, who is an exchange agent. She is going to buy powdered soap, cosmetics, a carton of exercise books, five boxes of pens, matches, cartons of candy, biscuits, sugar, rice, oils, iodized salt, etc. In the future she would like to be able to educate and feed her children. She is extremely grateful to Hekima for its support for female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic bank system. It should be noted that one of the customers is carrying her baby in the photo.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap, cosmetics, a carton of exercise books, five boxes of pens, matches, cartons of candy, biscuits, sugar, rice, oils, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Febzi

texts.en:
Febzi is 33 years old and the father of two children. For more than seven years, he has been employed in agriculture by keeping a cow and working on the land, planting corn and wheat. 

Currently, he is in need of a loan to purchase a trailer for his tractor so that he can work more effectively and efficiently. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for his tractor

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º año de bachillerato, su esposo se dedica al mismo negocio familiar. Ella posee un negocio de alquiler de sillas y mesas plásticas. 


El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de sillas y mesas plásticas para el alquiler. Ella sueña hacer de su negocio más grande, para que su familia tenga mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old; she studied up to the 3rd year of high school. Her husband is in the same family business. She owns a plastic chair and table rental business.

She will use the loan to buy plastic chairs and tables to rent. She hopes to make her business grow so that her family will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs and tables to rent.

loans.name: Markus Uwani

texts.en: Markus  Uwani is a 72-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Markus  Uwani is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Markus  Uwani can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, as a result of the inputs that she will purchase with this loan, Markus  Uwani is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked about the future, Markus  Uwani said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Isaac, Anthony, and Godiya, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is a 47-year-old farmer from Barau. As a Babban Gona member, Yohana is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yohana can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yohana is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.
