When asked, Yohana said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, in 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Yohana is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Samaila, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samaila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Samaila.  With this loan, Samaila is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is a vegetables seller and a married woman with a child. Her husband is a farmer, farming peanuts, and a motor taxi driver. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately USD 39 per day. 

Now, Phorn would like to apply for a loan of USD 1,000 to buy wood to finish building her house. This loan will help her live in a better condition. 

In the future, she is going to expand her selling and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy wood to finish building her house.

loans.name: Junior Haldair

texts.es:
Junior es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que trabaja día a día para poder brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja en un fundo Agrícola como obrero de campo y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, honesto y siempre se esfuerza por obtener resultados favorables.
Junior está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han ofrecido él podrá terminar de construir la casa de sus padres para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y puedan seguir viviendo  con mayor comodidad. Así, Junior seguirá luchando para más adelante poder cumplir una de sus mayores metas: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Junior is a young entrepreneur. He is 20 years old, single, and lives in Ica together with his family. 

He is a person eager to get ahead, and because of this he works day after day to be able to offer a better future to his family. 

He has worked on an agricultural estate for various years as a field worker and he is doing very well because he is very responsible, hardworking, honest, and always pushes himself to achieve favourable results. 

Junior is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered him, he will be able to finish building his parent's house so that they can improve their quality of life and can continue to live more comfortably. Junior will keep striving to later fulfill one of his major goals: "To have this own business."

loans.use: to finish building his home.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is 39 years. He is married, and together with his wife, has been blessed with two lovely children.

Gibson sells fish, a business he has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 600,000. Gibson has requested his sixth loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to support the education of his children by paying for their school fees. Gibson has successfully repaid all his previous loans.

Gibson's business is doing well, and with the anticipated profits he will be able to diversify his business further. His dreams and hopes are to have a successful business and happy family.

loans.use: to support the education of his children through paying school fees.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking oil, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking oil, rice, salt and other items. Her business goal is to own a large wholesale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, rice, salt and other items.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Elsa, a 57-year-old hardworking mother of 6 lovely children. Elsa hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that never experiences drought conditions and is always green from the beginning of the year to the end. Because of the favorable weather patterns Elsa has been doing farming for 6 years and she has really gained more experience and has been able to take care of her family.

Elsa practices mixed farming. That is, she grows crops and also keeps dairy cows on her farm. She also plants trees in her compound to make the environment look beautiful. Elsa has identified space on her land and wants to turn it to good use by keeping more dairy cows. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 52,000 to be able to buy a dairy cow. Through increased milk production, Elsa is sure of reaping more profits and providing a secure future for her children.

Elsa being old will want to secure the future of her children and grandchildren so that, in case anything happens, her children will never lack anything

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ya'u

texts.en: Ya'u remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Ya'u like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Ya'u,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Ya'u expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ya'u is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Matilde has been in this business for 42 years. Matilde earns additional income from pig fattening.

Matilde has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Mubarak, Sadik, and  Bakir. Ayuba is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ayuba will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ayuba can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Ayuba is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ma. Amy

texts.en:
Ma. Amy is a married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Amy is 44 years old.

Ma. Amy has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Amy requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Amy has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ma. Amy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en: Minkailu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Minkailu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Faruk, Lawal, and  Bello. Minkailu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Minkailu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Minkailu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Minkailu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yalie

texts.en:
Yalie is 40 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Yalie works very hard to provide for them.

Yalie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Yalie has restarted her recycled materials business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Yalie has taken a PHP 9,866 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Yalie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as soft drinks, water, beer, stout, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en: Bukurije at age 24 has 2 children ages 2 and 7 years old. They are all living in the Ashakli community and, like most people there, they are extremely poor and live in bad conditions. She is a housewife, staying home to care for the children and the house, but also receiving social help. Her husband is a musician who performs during celebrations and events. As his income is primarily obtained in the warmer spring and summer months, he tries to save the money he makes for the winter when his business is slow since the social help they receive is not enough to meet the family needs. Bukurije helps her husband making arrangements for performances and is very supportive of him and his work. She is now asking for a loan to be able to purchase new instruments for her husband. This loan will make it easier for him to find work and provide better entertainment to his clients. She promises to pay on time and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new musical instruments for her husband.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a 35-year-old woman. She is a mother of 5 children. She earns her living by doing embroidery work. She is very famous in her town for the aesthetic designs that she makes. Her husband’s income was not enough for the household. Therefore, at a very young age, she began to assist him in providing for the family. She has been able to expand her clientele over the years. Her business is constantly expanding as a result. In her 5th loan cycle, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to buy more frames, sequins, stones, needles and threads of different colors which will help in generating more income. She is hopeful that by expanding her business she will be able to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more frames, sequins, stones, needles and threads.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Waspam, tiene 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos, en edad escolar. Sin embargo, por motivos laborales desde hace más de 5 años se trasladó al municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y cómoda, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar material de construcción: maderas, clavo,  zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto
texts.en:
Marcelo: He is a persevering man, originally from Waspam. He is 37 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. However, more than five years ago he moved to the municipality of Puerto Cabezas for work.

With the goal of providing his family with a safe and comfortable home, he asks for his first loan to buy construction materials: wood, nails, zinc, and to cover the cost of labour. His dream is to have a home made of concrete.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: wood, nails, zinc, and to cover the cost of labour.

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en: Sameena is a 47-year-old widow, who has 4 children. She has been running a business of cloth sale for the past 3 years. She sells the cloth in her locality after purchasing it from wholesale at a slightly lower price. She has 4 children, and this business is the only source of income for her household. Sameena is in her 7th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and shows a good repayment history. Now, she has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase stock of cloth in more variety from the market. She hopes to get a good return from this loan, with which she wants to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cloth in more variety from the market.

loans.name: Malami

texts.en: Malami is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Malami joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Mutafa, Asiya, and  Yusufa. Malami is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Malami will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Malami can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Malami is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda Gambo is a 35-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Dauda Gambo is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dauda Gambo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Dauda Gambo is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Gabriel,Meshak, and Jeremiah. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Mary Asabe

texts.en: Mary  Asabe is a 27-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Mary  Asabe, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Mary  Asabe can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mary  Asabe is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Mary  Asabe said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my daughter, Dorcas, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Zoyramo

texts.ru: Зойрамо 48 лет. Она имеет четверых сыновей. Зойрамо замужем за экономистом. Ее старший сын работает с отцом. Зоирамо как и 60% населения занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Более 15 лет своей жизни она работала на земле. Зоирамо каждый год сажает новый урожай, и ни разу не пропустила ежегодный посев. Этот год тоже не стал исключением. Она начала посев нового урожая, но не хватила средств полностью закончить начатое. Зойрамо просит кредит, чтобы закончить посев. Она очень надеется на Вашу помощь и отзывчивость. Она много сил потратила, чтобы в будущем получить хороший урожай, оправдывающий ожидания.
texts.en: Zoyramo is 48 years old. She has four sons. Zoyramo is married to an economist. Her oldest son works with his father. Zoyramo, just like 60% of the population, is involved in agriculture. She has been working on land for over 15 years of her life. Zoyramo plants a new crop every year and has never missed an annual sowing. This year is no exception. She started the sowing of a new crop, but did not have enough money to complete what she started. Zoyramo is requesting this loan to finish the sowing. She hopes very much for Your help and responsiveness. She spent a lot of energy to obtain a good harvest in the future that meets her expectations.

loans.use: to complete sowing the new crop

loans.name: Janik

texts.en:
Janik is 63 years old and he lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. He has no higher education and for several years worked at the private company as a driver. With his wife, Janik is engaged in farming and agriculture. On their nice farm they take care of two cows, two calves, two piglets and twenty chickens. They are happy to sell their farm products such as a cheese, milk, butter, meat and eggs. Janik also has a rich orchard full of apple, pear, apricot and plum trees. As Janik likes to say, he does every work around the farm with his beloved wife and with great pleasure.

Janik asks for a loan of 120,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy animal fodder for his cattle. This will ensure that he has enough feed for his animals along with the hay he has gathered himself.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu remembers the starvation his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Abdu like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Abdu,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Abdu expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Abdu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal remembers the starvation his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Lawal like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Lawal,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Lawal expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Lawal is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Jelena

texts.en:
Jelena is a housewife who takes care of her three children and home while her husband works in a municipality and also in private radio. She is searching for a job but it has been very difficult for her to find one in her minority community. Despite having two incomes, Jelena and her husband have still not been able to save enough money to complete renovations for their home. 

Jelena is requesting a loan to replace the doors to her house and to build a terrace. Her loan will help her to have better living conditions. She hopes in the future to have a job so she can continue to improve their situation. Jelena’s goal is to give her children better education and opportunities in their futures. She is grateful for the help and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to replace house doors to and build a terrace

loans.name: Apporinarie

texts.en: Apporinarie is 43 years old. She is a mother of six children. She has spent ten years in the business of selling foodstuffs. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs such as maize and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 30 year old farmer from Kiyawa. As a Babban Gona member, Naomi is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Naomi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Naomi, is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Naomi said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Naomi is on her way to achieving this dream

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Dragna, age 42, works in a kindergarten. She lives with her husband and their 21-year-old daughter in a minority community in Kosovo. 

Their daughter is ill, and she is unable to walk without the help of her parents. They have spent a lot of money on treatments and therapy to assist her in being able to walk independently, but so far without success. Dragana's husband is not working at this time, so he has been able to take care of their daughter while Dragana works. 

Dragana is asking for a loan in order to renovate their very old home and to make essential repairs that have not been completed because of lack of money due to medical expenses. 

She hopes that her daughter will eventually be healthy and able to enjoy her life. 

She wants to thank all of her lenders.

loans.use: to make essential repairs to the very old home in which her family lives

loans.name: Fakhrau Nisa

texts.en:
Fakhrau Nisa is a 39-year-old hardworking and energetic lady who is the mother of six children. For the past five years, she has been supporting her family by stitching bags which she then sells in the market. The income from her business has enabled her to meet the day-to-day expenses of her household. 

Fakhrau Nisa is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to purchase fabric to makes bags along with thread, zippers, and other materials. This will be her sixth loan cycle. Fakhrau Nisa hopes that more investment in her business will help to generate more income and provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to makes bags along with thread, zippers, and other materials.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is 42 years old and married with three children. They live in the Ashkali community in very poor conditions despite the fact that her husband is employed. Emine’s husband works in a private company but his salary is so low he also collects plastic bags to supplement his income. 

Emine is requesting a loan to purchase a trailer for their business of collecting bags. Her loan will help them be able to collect more bags and travel faster, thus becoming more efficient and increasing their income. Emine sees a lot of potential income and profit from this business and plans to continue in the future. Her goal is to be able to improve the living conditions for her family. Emine promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her business collecting bags

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es: Mónica es soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad que se encuentra asistiendo a la escuela, Mónica tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su hija y con sus padres, cuenta Mónica que sus padres se dedican a la ganadería y que es de ahí que a ella le inculcaron a dedicarse a esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un vacona para cuidarla y que después que se haga vaca obtener ingresos de la leche, Mónica dice que aspira trabajar duro para bienestar de su hija.
texts.en: Mónica is single and has a 5 year old daughter who is going to school. Mónica is 24 years old and lives with her daughter and her parents. Mónica says that her parents work with livestock and that is how she ended up working in this activity. The loan will be used to buy a young calf and care for it until it becomes a cow and generate income from it's milk. Mónica says that she hopes to work hard for the well-being of her child.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Dulia

texts.es: Dulía de 49 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 14 años. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que en su afán por dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia inicio hace 15 años con la venta de tamales los cuales elabora y vende los siguientes días: miércoles hace de elote, jueves hace de frijol y los de gallina los hace el domingo así logra apoyar económicamente a su esposo. Dulía necesita poner techo al corredor de su vivienda que también utiliza para la venta de sus productos. Para lo que esta solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lamina galvanizada y madera, para proteger sus pertenencias de la lluvia y tener un lugar agradable para su clientela.
texts.en: Dulía is 49 years old and lives with her life companion and her 14 year old son. She is a very tenacious woman who in her eagerness to provide a better quality of living for her family started selling tamales fifteen years ago. She makes and sells tamales on the following days: Wednesdays she makes corn tamales, on Thursdays it's bean tamales and on Sundays it's chicken tamales. Dulía needs to build a roof over the corridor of her house which she also uses for the sale of her products. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized laminate and wood to protect her belongings from the rain and to have an agreeable spot for her clientele.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate and wood to build a roof over her patio.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона замужем. Ей 25 лет. У нее двое маленьких детей. Муж Марчоны находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Она живет с родителями мужа на районе Хамадони. Марчона занимается животноводством. В течение 5 лет деятельность скотоводство является основным источником дохода в семью. Марчона хочет получить кредит и купить пару телят для увеличения количество скотин и повышения доходности от деятельности. Она покупает телят и после определенного дня откорма продает их на рынке с наценкой. Поддержите Марчону в достижении цели.
texts.en: Marjona is married. She is 25 years old and has two small children. Marjona's husband works in the Russian Federation. She lives with her husband's parents in the Hamadoni district. Marjona is involved in animal husbandry. Animal husbandry has been the primary source of income for the family for 5 years. Marjona wants to obtain a loan and buy a couple of calves to increase the number of livestock and profitability from the business. She buys calves and sells them at a market with a markup after a set period of fattening them up. Help Marjona in achieving her goal.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount and business profitability

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru: Зеби жительница не большого района Хамадони. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем за строителя. В браке у них имеется четверо детей. Старший сын Зеби находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Зеби сама занимается продажей овощей и фруктов в местном рынке Хамадони. В торговом бизнесе она 10 лет и уже знает все тонкости своей работы. В работе ей в основном помогает дочь. Зеби считает, что пора расширить деятельность и просит кредит, чтобы купить больше товара и увеличить ассортимент фруктов и овощей. Она надеется, результат кредита оправдает ее ожидания.
texts.en: Zebi is a resident of a small district of Hamadoni. She is 38 years old and married to a construction worker. They have four children. Zebi's oldest son works in the Russian Federation. Zebi is involved in selling vegetables and fruits at a local market in Hamadoni. She has been in a retail business for 10 years and already knows all of the nuances of her work. Her daughter primarily helps her with the work. Zebi thinks that it is time to expand her business and is requesting a loan to purchase more product and increase the selection of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that the result of the loan will meet her expectations.

loans.use: to expand her fruits and vegetables retail business

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana comes from a minority community in Kosovo. She is the mother of three children and is employed as a nurse while her husband works in a municipality. Both Mirjana and her husband receive very low salaries, making things difficult for them.  As with all minority communities, they are living in bad conditions. After the war, the economy was destroyed and the community has not been able to further develop or prosper. 

Mirjana is requesting a loan to complete renovations on her her very old house, specifically to repair the roof. Her loan will help her family be able to address a longstanding problem that affects the health and living environment of her family. Mirjana is grateful to lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to renovate her house and repair the roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cooking oil, rice, salt, and other items

loans.name: Nerhy Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Nerhy es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable tiene 42 años vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto  a su  esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años el cual es muy visitado y conocido por los vecinos de su comunidad. 
Doña Nerhy necesita el crédito para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal y leña,  con la que podrá seguir elaborando su producto, espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que contara con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su trabajo de forma continua satisfaciendo así los pedidos de sus clientes con los cuales espera que sus ventas tengan un aumento en sus ingresos.
Doña Nerhy espera que su negocio crezca y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia a cumplir los sueños y metas de estos como el de que sus hijos terminen los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en el futuro.


Choluteca, Honduras - Junio  2014
texts.en:
Nerhy is a hard working and responsible 42 year old woman who lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and two children. She has had a business making and selling tortillas for 15 years and is popular and well known in her neighbourhood. Nerhy will use a loan to buy more raw materials (maize, lime and wood) which she will use to carry on making tortillas. She hopes to make good use of a loan as she relies on these materials to keep working, to keep satisfying the demands of her clients, and to increase sales and increase her income.

Nerhy hopes her business will grow so that she can carry on supporting her family and helping them to follow their dreams: her two children want to finish school and open opportunities for themselves in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Gavharbi

texts.ru: Ее зовут Гавхарби. Ей 40 лет. Она вдова и малолетних детей растет одна. Гавхарби с семьей живет на районе Хамадони. Там же она работает. У нее имеется не большой продуктовый магазин. В сфере торговли она около 5 лет. Чтобы открыть магазин ей стоило немало усилий, и она добилась поставленной цели. Гавхарби знает, как обращаться с клиентами и как правильно продавать товар. Теперь она хочет расширить бизнес и иметь больше дохода, чтобы покрыть растущие расходы детей. На данный момент ей необходимо привести новый товар и пополнить пустые полки запасы продуктов питания, но достаточной суммы денег у нее отсутствует, и Гавхарби обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This is Gavharbi. She is 40 years old. She is a widow and raising her young children by herself. Gavharbi and her family live in the Hamadoni district. She also works. She has a small food market. She has been in a retail business for about 5 years. Opening this market cost her a lot of effort, but she achieved the set goal. Gavharbi knows how to treat her customers and how to sell merchandise well. Now she wants to expand her business and have more income in order to cover the children's growing expenses. At the present time, she needs to bring in new merchandise and fill empty stock shelves with food products, but does not have a sufficient amount of money, and, thus, Gavharbi requested this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her food market

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, age 49, fattens pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years, and also earns an additional income from food vending. She lives with her husband and their four children in Cebu.

Sonia requested PhP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jaime Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Jaime es un experto electricista desde hace más de 20 años. Viene realizando trabajos particulares a lo largo del municipio de Medellín.
Jaime en busca de mejores oportunidades e ingresos para su familia y tratando de estar más cerca de sus hijos, decidió iniciar con un negocio de venta de helados en su propia casa desde hace unos 9 años; de este modo su esposa puede colaborarle con el negocio y así aumentar sus utilidades.
Estas dos actividades le han permitido sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 3 hijos menores de edad que están en proceso de crecimiento y educación.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de sillas y mesas para darle un valor agregado a su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, adicionalmente desea actualizar las herramientas que utiliza como electricista.
texts.en: Jaime has been an expert electrician for more than 20 years. He does jobs for individuals around the city of Medellin. He is looking for better opportunities and more income for his family and is trying to be closer to his children. He decided to set up a business selling ice cream in his own home 9 years ago; this means that his wife can help him with the business and increase his earnings. These two jobs have enabled him to support his family which consists of his wife and three young children who are all growing up and attending school. He is applying for a loan to buy chairs and tables to give added value to his shop and increase his sales.  In addition, he also wants to update the tools he uses as an electrician.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for his business and tools for his job.

loans.name: Edwin Vinicio

texts.es: Vinicio es un joven soltero de 31 años de edad, el vive con su abuelita que debido a que es muy mayorcita ya no puede realizar ninguna actividad, y en Vinicio quien la cuida y vela por ella, Vinicio tiene un hijo de 5 años que asiste a la escuela y aunque no está todos los días juntos con su hijo, si se hace responsable de la educación y alimento de su hijo, Vinicio se dedica al jornal y a la  crianza de chanchos y es en este negocio en e l que va a invertir el crédito, el aspira seguir  trabajando y tener los ingresos necesario para cuidando de su abuelita.
texts.en: Vinicio is single and 31 years old. He lives with his grandmother who is very old and cannot work. It is Vinicio who cares for her and watches over her. Vinicio has a 5 year old son who goes to school and although he is not together with his son every day, he is responsible for the education and nourishment of his son. Vinicio works as day labor and raises pigs. It is in this business that he will invest the loan. He hopes to continue working and generate the revenue needed to care for his grandmother.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 20-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Amina, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Amina can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Amina is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Amina said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my daughter Binta, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my child is well educated”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No, age 44 and a widower, sells fish to earn his living. He has been engaged in this activity since 1999. He has four children, one of whom is a student. Another is a soldier at Pichnil. The family lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang, and together they can earn approximately $13.50 per day. 

No would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to increase his capital so that he can buy more fish to offer for sale. 

In the future, he intends to keep expanding his business and to support his child through finishing university.

loans.use: to increase his capital so that he can buy more fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogos,la socia lleva a diferentes lugares y amigos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues to work in her business selling shoes by catalog. She goes to different places and friends to sell. She has been in this business for a number of years and things are going well for her. The member's dream is to have a stall where she can sell her shoes. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes. She is happy for the loan and promises to pay the installments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods for cooking such as rice, salt, red oil, and onions

loans.name: Niño Jesús De Las Orquideas  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Niño Jesús De Las Orquídeas el cual está formado por 10 mujeres y 3 hombres, todos ellos muy trabajadores  que con la ayuda del créditos están sacando adelante sus negocios y así mejorando la calidad de vida de sus familias, ellos se dedican a varias actividades en su mayoría al comercio. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Fidencia, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. 
Doña Fidencia es una muy buena madre que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Niños Jesús de las Orquídeas meets every fortnight in Las Orquídeas, Portoviejo. The group is made up of 3 men and 10 women, all of whom are very hard working and, with the help of loans, will expand their businesses, and as such, improve quality of life for their families. They are involved in various activities, mainly within the retail sector.

One of the partners of the group is Fidencia who is a 53 year old single mother with three grown-up children, one of whom still lives with her. Fidencia is a very good mother who has always liked achieving things through hard work. She works selling clothes and Avon and Yanbal cosmetics, beauty products, perfumes and accessories. She works for 2 to 3 hours per day, three days per week, leaving products with clients on credit and collecting payment very eight days. She has been doing this for three years and it is going very well. Perfume and cosmetics are what she sells most frequently. A loan will help Fidencia to buy clothing, perfumes and other cosmetics. She has attended five meetings with the credit group and likes it because it helps her move forward. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en:
Nikola is 27 years old and recently married, living with his wife and parents in a minority community in Kosovo. Their community is not developed and is very poor, with most of the people living in substandard conditions and unemployed. Nikola however, is currently employed in a municipality and is the main source of income for his family. 

He has always had to help care for his father, who is blind, and work to support the family because of his father’s disability. Nikola has planned to build a new house because their house is very old and in a condition that is not suitable for living. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to be able to start building a small new house. He is very grateful for the lenders and the opportunity that they can provide for him and his family.

loans.use: To build a small new house

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 25-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Esther, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Esther can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Esther is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Esther said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Abubakar,and Elkana,and Justina, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
El socio se sigeu dedicando al negocio de venta de artefactos como televisor,refrigeradoras y equipos de sonido,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 p.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artefactos.El socio solicita el credito para conmprar televisor,equipo de sonido y refrigeradora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with the business of selling appliances like televisions, refrigerators, and sound equipment.  The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  He has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for him.

His dream is to expand his business of selling appliances.  He is requesting the loan to buy televisions, sound equipment, and refrigerators.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy televisions, sound equipment, and refrigerators.

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie is 36 years old, married and has four children, three in school.

Wennie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Wennie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Wennie has been an NWTF borrower since 2010. She plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Wennie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, Wennie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en: Godelive is 53 years old and married with four children. With the loan, she would like to buy more items for her store such as rice, soaps and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, soaps, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre humilde y trabajador, padre de un joven de 11 años y feliz habitante del municipio de Rionegro.
Toda su vida ha trabajado en diferentes actividades, pero desde hace unos 10 años decidió establecerse como independiente e inicio un negocio de venta de bebidas y frituras en una pequeña chaza móvil que ubica todos los días al frente de un colegio del municipio.
Es un hombre tenaz y muy persistente que hace todo lo que está a su alcance para obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Tiene la esperanza de poder obtener una ayuda y de este modo realizar el mantenimiento a su chaza y surtirla con productos nuevos.
Esto le dará un pequeño impulso para seguir adelante con su actividad.
texts.en: Alberto is a humble and hard-working man. He is the father of an 11 year old son and lives happily in the municipality of Rionegro. All his life he has worked in different activities, but ten years ago he established himself independently and started a business selling drinks and fried food with a small mobile cart. He sets up every day in front of  the municipal school. He is a tenacious man and very persistent in doing all that is in his reach to get the revenues necessary to sustain his family. He has the hope to be able to obtain help and in this way do maintenance on his cart and stock up on new products. This will give him a small boost to continue onward with his activity.

loans.use: to stock his business and to repair his cart.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita, age 41, is a married, Ashkali woman with four children. Her husband works in a western country to earn a living and sends money to his family regularly. Her older son is working construction earning a low salary. (He is in the photo with Drita.)

She lives in an old house which is in need of renovations to improve the living conditions of her family. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to replace the windows and doors of the house and to complete some minor renovations. She hopes that in the future her husband will be back home again. Her goal is to open a private business when he returns. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her house, replacing windows and doors

loans.name: Tehseen

texts.en:
Tehseen is married and has one child. She is trying hard to fulfill her family demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She operates a business sewing gloves, which she has been doing for three years. Due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  

Tehseen has one sewing machine, which was purchased with the loan she received from Kashf Foundation few years ago. Due to her work, she is respected in her family. She feels that she has achieved a lot over the years. However, to meet the increasing demand, she requires another, better quality sewing machine. Tehssen requested a loan for 45,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a better quality sewing machine, spools of threads, and cloth. She is hopeful that she will be able to increase her sales in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality sewing machine,  spools of threads, and cloth.

loans.name: Yasmine

texts.en: Yasmine is a 32-year-old married woman who has six children. Yasmine is a very dedicated mother. She started the service of tailoring in her community a few years ago with the aim of providing a better living standard for her children. She is known for her good quality sewing skills around her locality. Her main customers are her neighbors and the people living in the nearby areas. She has requested her fourth loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, needles, zippers and laces in various colors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good life and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, needles, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Aisheri

texts.en: Aisheri is a 50 year old farmer from Kiyawa. As a Babban Gona member, Aisheri is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Aisheri can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Aisheri is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Aisheri said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home, in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Aisheri is on her way to achieving this dream

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa remembers not being able to feed her family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Hauwa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hauwa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Hauwa.   With this loan, Hauwa is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru:
Чамила веселая, жизнерадостная, гостеприимная женщина, любимая жена и самая лучшая мама. Чамила замужем за строителя. У них совместно трое детей. Они живут на небольшом районе Хамадони. 
  3 года назад Чамила решила начать бизнес, не выходя из дома. Она начала заниматься куплей и продажей скотин. Она знала, как ухаживать за животными и решила свой опыт и знания использовать в прибыльном бизнесе. Вот уже в течение 3 лет она продвигает свой деятельность. Чамила хочет получить кредит и на денежные средства приобрести пару голов телят для откорма и продажи. Таким образом, она расширить бизнес и принесет прибыль.
texts.en: Jamila is a happy, lively and hospitable woman, loving wife and the best mother. Jamila is married to a construction worker, and they have three children. They live in a small district of Hamadoni. Jamila decided to start a home business 3 years ago. She became involved in reselling livestock. She knew how to care for animals and decided to use her experience and knowledge in a profitable business. She has been running her business for 3 years. Jamila wants to obtain this loan to purchase a couple of calves for fattening up and resale. This is how she would expand her business and have more profit.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to expand her animal husbandry business

loans.name: Andres Fernando

texts.es: Con 23 años de edad Andres se dedica a la agricultura y también es integrante de una banda musical de su pueblo, el vive con sus padres, con una hermana y una sobrina, Andres trabaja sembrando con su padre y comenta que es  él quien le enseño a sembrar y a cultivar sus plantas y que Andres se dedica a trabajar al jornal y al trabajo en el campo desde que tenía 13 años, Andres va a invertir el crédito en la compra de abono y fungicidas, Andres tiene un hijo de 3 años y de su negocio espera que le vaya bien en esta cosecha para seguir apoyando y  para bienestar de sus hijo.
texts.en:
Andres, age 23, works in agriculture.  He is also a member of a musical band in his village.  He lives with his parents, a sister, and a niece.  Andres works with his father planting.  He says it was his father who taught him to plant and to cultivate their plants.  Andres has been doing day work and working in the field for 13 years.

Andres will use the loan to buy fertilizer and fungicides.  

Andres has a three year old son.

Andres hopes that this harvest will go well for him so that he will continue supporting his son’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (rice, salt, red oil, onion, cassava, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 44 years old, married and with her husband has been blessed with two children. Her husband provides additional income for the family.

Zaituni sells food, a business she has run for one year. She earns a monthly income of KES 60,500. Zaituni has requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy food items like potatoes, baking flour and vegetables.

With the anticipated profits, Zaituni will be able to expand her business further. Her dreams and hopes are to have a healthy family as well as expanded business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of food items.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a single woman with four children, ages 2 to 11 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a semi-urban area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business that will enable her to support her family's needs. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos ortopedicos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,le socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos ortopedicos.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos ortopédicos.



El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with the business of selling orthopedic shoes.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  His dream is to expand his business of selling orthopedic shoes.

He is requesting the loan to buy orthopedic shoes.

The member is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy orthopedic shoes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 62-year-old, married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Susana's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Susana has restarted her clothing sales business and is committed to regain what she lost. Susana is taking out a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Susana has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to restart her life in a new home. In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Grupo El Potrero Group

texts.es: Santos es una persona de 49 años de edad, Unido (es el que aparece en medio de las dos integrantes del grupo), vive en el departamento de Sololá, su actividad productiva es la agricultura, los principales cultivos que produce son de ciclo corto dentro de ellos la zanahoria y la cebolla, además es un producto demandado a nivel local, eligió esta actividad debido que cuenta con terreno propio y un sistema de riego para la época seca, es por ello que formaron un grupo para apoyarse en todo el proceso productivo de las hortalizas y así comercializar toda la producción, con el propósito de generar una mayor utilidad, contribuyendo al sostenimiento de la familia. Santos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas, semilla y fertilizante para el cultivo de cebolla, con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de la producción y obtener una mayor rentabilidad del producto.
texts.en:
Santo is 49 years old and married (that's him in between the two other partners in the group). He lives in the Sololá region and works in agriculture. He mainly grows short-season crops such as onions and carrots, which are also the crops that are in demand locally. He chose this activity because he has his own land and an irrigation system for dry periods. 

He formed a partnership to support the whole production process of his land and through this, to expand production and increase his yield to help support his family. A loan will help Santos to buy agricultural supplies, seeds and fertiliser to grow onions, with the aim of improving the quality of his crops and get a better income from his produce.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing onions.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 38-year-old married mother of four daughters and two sons. Five of her children go to school. For two years, she and her husband have run a business selling milk. They have two buffalo for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Kousar’s job is to look after the buffalo and milk them. Together, they are supporting their family. However, to provide for their children’s education, they need to earn more income. Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. She hopes that the increased milk collection will help generate more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Fazilamo

texts.ru: Фазиламо 54 года. Она вдова. Фалиламо с дочкой живет в одном из гостеприимных районов под названием Хамадони. Хамадони не большой район, но там живут люди с большой душой. И Фазиламо с дочкой одни из этих жителей. Она обеспечивает себя и дочку от дохода своего магазина. У Фазиламо имеется не большой продуктовый магазин. Уже в течение многих лет она привозит товар и перепродает их в собственном магазине. Она с большим трудом открыла собственный бизнес и дорожит им. Доход от бизнеса является единственный источником дохода в семью. Фазиламо хочет привести новые продукты для магазина и расширить ассортимент товара. Но ей не хватает средств, поэтому она просит  кредит.
texts.en: Fazilamo  is 54. She is a widow. Fazilamo and her daughter live in the hospitable district called Hamadoni. Hamadoni is not a big area, but there are people there who have big hearts. Fazilamo and her daughter are those kind of people.  She supports herself and her daughter with income from her shop. Fazilamo has a small grocery shop. For many years, she has bought goods and resold them in her own store. It was very difficult for her to establish her business, so she cherishes it. Profit from the business is the family's only source of income. Fazilamo wants to bring new products into the store and expand the variety of goods she offers, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she is asking for a loan.

loans.use: get new products to expand the variety of goods on offer in her shop.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es: Jorge tiene 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando,  el se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y también trabaja de chofer  de un carro, su esposa se dedica a vender en un puesto de comidas, Jorge va a invertir el dinero del crédito comprando chanchos para dejarlos en chancheras que le presta su suegra, Jorge dice que su trabajo y el de su esposa es para comprar una casa para sus hijos y que ellos tengan una vida tranquila y que sigan adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en: Jorge is 36 years old, he is married and has two children that are studying.  He raises pork and also works as a driver. His wife sells food at a stand.  Jorge is going to invest the money from the loan in buying pigs to raise them at the barns his mother-in-law lets him use. Jorge says that he works and his wife works to buy a house for their children so that they can have a quiet life and continue with their studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a 36-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Maryamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 36 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make as a Babban Gona member, her said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Monday, Tamar, and  Andrew.”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Not

texts.en:
Not, age 56 and widowed, prepares and sells food items for children in her community. She offers porridge, ice with syrup, and cakes for sale. 

Not lives in the province of Kampong Chhnang with her family. Three of her children are garment workers, one is a teacher, and one is a student. Together, the family can earn approximately $25 per day.

Not is applying for a loan to cover the wedding expenses of one of her children next month. She and her family are happy about this upcoming event, and the loan will allow them to celebrate the marriage.

In the future, she intends to support her daughter to the completion of a university degree.

loans.use: to cover her child's wedding expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, injections and blood syrup for resale.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru:
Мукаддас отзывчивый и открытый человек. Она прекрасно введет свой маленький бизнес. Мукаддас торгует детской одеждой. Раньше  привозила с Бишкека, но так как сейчас не сезон и ее бизнес не очень хорошо продвигается, решила не ехать и дожидаться сентября – осеннего сезона. На данный момент товар у нее остался не много. По словам Мукаддас можно понять, что она сильная духом женщина и не намерена бросать свой бизнес из-за временных трудностей. Ведь дело, которое она начала несколько лет тому назад, ведет ее по жизни и основной источник обеспеченности ее семьи. У Мукаддас трое детей. Все трое школьники и являются на иждивении у Мукаддас. Так как сама не получила высшее образование, намерена обучать детей и дать им возможность стать квалифицированными специалистами. 
Мукаддас является лояльной клиенткой МДО «Арванд», кредитируется на протяжении двух лет и имеет хорошую историю погашения. Она планировала получить очередной кредит  ближе к сезону, но Мукаддасу срочно понадобилась не большая сумма денег. Ей принесли не дорогие детские распашонки от продаж, которых может получить определенный доход. Поэтому Мукаддас не хочет упускать шанс и хочет получить не большой кредит.  С этим намерением она, не задумываясь, обратилась в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Очень надеется на поддержку  и заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en:
Mukadas is a responsive and open person. She beautifully runs her small business. Mukadas sells children's clothing. Previously, she brought goods from Bishkek, but because this is not the season and her business is not advancing well, she decided not to wait until September or the fall season. Currently, she does not have a lot of merchandise left. Judging from Mukadas's words, it can be understood that she is a strong-willed woman and does not intend to abandon her business due to temporary difficulties. After all, the business that she started several years ago, guides her in life and provides the primary source of income for her family. Mukadas has three children. All of them are school students and supported by Mukadas. Because she never obtained a higher education, she intends to educate her children and provide them with an opportunity to become qualified specialists.

Mukadas is a loyal client of MDO Arvand and has been obtaining financing for two years and has a good history of repaying loans. She had originally planned her next loan closer to the next season, but Mukadas urgently needed a small sum of money. She got a delivery of affordable children's shirts that she could sell and earn a set income. This is why Mukadas does not want to miss this chance and wants to obtain a small loan. With this goal in mind and not thinking twice, she came to MDO Arvand for a loan. She hopes very much for the support and is grateful for the help in advance.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tie dye (Gala) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough rice oil,meat,cube, etc for cooking to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will use the money to grow her business and buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
38-year-old Kouser is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been successfully running a general store with the assistance of her husband. They offer various goods for daily use. Kouser handles customers in the general store and her husband is responsible for stocking the shelves on a timely basis. 

Kouser is in her eighth loan cycle and she has now requested a loan of PKR 55,000. With this loan amount, she intends to purchase stocks of shampoos, creams, talcum powders, and edibles like candies, rice, and flour for her shop. She dreams of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of shampoos, creams, talcum powders and edibles like candies, rice, and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.ru: Эта женщина Хуринисо. Она живет на районе Хамадони. Ей 38 лет. Хуринисо замужем, но ее муж находиться на заработках за рубежом. Хуринисо в Хамадони занимается продажей детской одежды. В сфере продаже она уже 10 лет. Ее работа приносит ей ежедневный доход, по этой причине ей нравиться ее работа. Сейчас Хуринисо необходимо привести новый товар соответствующий сезону для перепродажи, чтобы расширить ассортимент товара и увеличить доходность от деятельности. Но у нее не хватает небольшой суммы денег для совершения покупки и она с надеждой обратилась за кредитом. Ей не у кого брать в долг, чтобы расширить бизнес, и она надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: This woman is Khuriniso. She lives in Hamadoni. She is 38 years old. Khuriniso is married, but her husband is working abroad. Khuriniso sells children's clothing in Hamadoni. She has been doing this for ten years. She likes her job because she is able to earn income daily. Khuriniso now must bring in new goods appropriate to the season in order to increase her variety of goods and the business's profitability. However, she is short of money, and so she, filled with hope, requested a loan. She does not have anyone else she can borrow from to expand her business, and she is hoping for your help.

loans.use: bring in children's clothing to increase sales.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es:
La socia Susan se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cámaras digitales, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las cámaras digitales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cámaras digitales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Susan still works selling digital cameras. She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m. The member has been doing this business for many years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell digital cameras. The member is requesting a loan to buy digital cameras. The member is happy with the loan and promises to meet her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy digital cameras.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase the number of cattle she has.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара проживает вместе с дочерьми в районе Рудаки. Ей 41 год. Муж Гулсары находится в России. У нее двое дочерей, одна студентка, другая вместе с матерью занимается шитьем. Гулсара более восьми лет занимается шитьем. Гулсара у себя дома открыла небольшое ателье. Она берет кредит для приобретения модернизованной машинки для вышивки и необходимое оборудование, так как ее дочь помогает ей и им обоим трудно работать на одной швейной машинке.
texts.en: Gulsara lives with her daughters in Rudaki. She is 41. Gulsara's husband is in Russia. She has two daughters. One is a student; the other works with her mother sewing. Gulsara  has been sewing for more than eight years. Gulsara has a small tailor's shop in her home.  Since her daughter helps her, and they both work hard with only one sewing machine, she is borrowing money to buy necessary accessories and an upgraded sewing machine.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine so she and her daughter can sew.

loans.name: Sopheany's Group

texts.en:
Sopheany, age 35, is a rice farmer. She has been engaged in this business for seven years and can earn about KHR 26,000 per day, which allows her to save a small sum each day for the future needs of her family. 

Sopheany's husband is a teacher, but the rice farm provides the main source of the family's income. They live with their two children in a rural village of the Bovel district in the province of Battambang. One of the children still attends school.

She is presently serving as the group leader of three borrowers as she requests her fifth loan from VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy school materials for her child’s education, and and she will also use a portion of it to buy essential household supplies. 

Her goal is to keep her child in school and to continue to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy school materials for her child’s education

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, age 50, runs a bakery business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She and her husband have five children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa requested a PhP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like flour and sugar for her bread production business.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and sugar to use in her bakery

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба жительница района Вахдат. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. Махбуба проживает вместе с мужем, свекровью, свекром и его братом. Махбубе 23 года. Муж Махбубы предоставляет услугу на своем маршрутном транспорте. У Махбубы среднее образование. После окончания школы ее выдали замуж. Махбуба является матерью двоих детей. 
Махбуба занимается животноводством в доме мужа. В разведении скота ей помогают ее муж и свекор. Животноводством Махбуба занимается с детства. Это дело ей очень нравится. На сегодняшний день Махбуба занимается шитьем и разведением скота. Она берет кредит для закупа телят, чтобы продолжить это дело. Она ждет от Вас поддержки.
texts.en:
Mahbuba lives in Vahdat. She is 23. She is married. Mahbuba lives with her husband, mother-in-law, father-in-law and his brother. Mahbuba is 23. Mahbuba's husband drives a shuttle. Mahbuba has a secondary education. After high school, she got married. Mahbuba is the mother of two children. 

Mahbuba works in animal husbandry in her husband's house. Her husband and her father-in-law help with the cattle. Mahbuba has been working with livestock since childhood. She loves doing it. Mahbuba works sewing and raising livestock. She is taking out a loan to buy calves to continue this work. She is waiting for your support.

loans.use: buy calves.

loans.name: Rosine Tacky's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée en Mai 2011 est constitué de 21 membres qui habitent tous dans la même localité. Leur activité principale st le commerce.

Fatoumata se trouvant debout a gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est veuve et mère de six(06)enfants dont 05 garçons et 01 fille. Elle fait du commerce et de la transformation de fonio comme activité.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter un sac de 100 kg de fonio d'une valeur de 55000f et les 5000f pour les frais de transport.

Avec son bénéfice, elle va assurer la nourriture ,la scolarité de ces enfants et aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Created in May 2011, this group consists of 21 members who all live in the same district. Their main activity is commerce.

Fatoumata is the featured borrower for this group. She is the member standing at the left and raising her arm. She is a widowed mother of six (06) children, five boys and one girl. She is a merchant whose activity involves the processing of fonio, a type of millet.

With her loan, she will buy one 100-kg sack of fonio for 55,000f, and she will pay 5,000f for transportation.

Her profits will help to feed her children and pay for their tuition. She also plans to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy fonio.

loans.name: Saul Adalberto

texts.es: Saul tiene 71 años de edad, el es soltero y comenta que nunca se caso ya que cuando su padre estaba a punto de fallecer le hizo prometer que cuidaría a su madre que se quedaba enferma y que incluso no podía  ni caminar, asi que Saul se dedico en su totalidad a sus madre y cuando su madre falleció el ya tenía una edad avanzada como para formar un hogar, Saul se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y con el crédito que le otorgue Fodemi va a comprar una vaca, de este negocio el aspira seguir trabajando y en su vejez vivir dignamente.
texts.en: Saul is 71 years old, is single and says that he never married because when his father was at the point of dying he made Saul promise that he would care for his mother who was sick and couldn't even walk. So Saul dedicated himself to his mother fully, and when his mother died he was already old to start a home and family. Saul makes a living from agriculture and raising cattle, and with the loan that Fodemi is granting him he is going to buy a cow. He aspires to keep working in this business and to live in a dignified manner in his old age.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and offer for sale

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, age 59, saw her business and family home destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has since restarted her dry goods business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She and her husband have two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Shirly has requested a PhP 9,720 housing loan through NWTF in order to rebuild her family home. She is using her loan funds to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Shirly is committed to rebuilding her family's devastated life. In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor in order to rebuild her family home

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne, age 29, runs a general store business to earn an income. 

She lives with her husband and their two children.

With her loan funds, she would like to buy more items to offer for sale in her store, such as rice and cooking oil. She plans to use her expected profits to build savings toward a better future.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice and cooking oil to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Fidélité Group
