texts.fr: La cliente Muteba est une commerçante depuis 6 ans, présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Fidélité», entrepreneur, dynamique âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle installe son business dans un marché du centre ville. Elle va acheter 350 paires de souliers. Son conjoint est un militaire de l’armée loyaliste. Elle débuta son activité avec de fonds reçu de Hekima. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Muteba has been a merchant for six years. She is a member and the president of the business group Fidélité. A dynamic 43-year-old entrepreneur, she is married with eight children who all go to school. Her husband is a member of the loyalist army.    

Muteba sells used shoes. She conducts her sales at a market downtown. She initially started her activity with funding from Hekima. She plans to use this loan to buy 350 pairs of shoes.  

Her goals for the future are to bolster her working capital and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. 

Muteba wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for making a wise choice in helping women entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system by 
granting them loans without collateral, especially in these difficult post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 350 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, salt, red oil, and onions to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz María es estudiante de Enfermería, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Luz Maria, tengo 36 años de edad y vivo en San Pedro de Macoris,  Rep. Dom., vivo con mis hijos y mi esposo,  somos de pocos recursos pero mi esposo me ayuda mucho a pesar de que no gana mucho. Quiero seguir mis estudios ya que me había parado por falta de dinero, por esa razón estoy pidiendo un préstamo que sirva para terminar mi carrera de licenciatura en enfermería. Mi deseo es trabajar en el mejor hospital del país para brindar mis servicios a los pacientes en especial a los niños.Mi sueño personal es ser buen ejemplo e inspiración a mis dos hijos para que cuando ellos terminen la secundaria tengan el deseo de ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Luz María is a nursing student; she is asking for a loan to be able to cover her educational expenses. This is her story: 

My name is Luz Maria, I am 36 years old and I live in San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. I live with my children and my husband; we have few resources but my husband helps me a lot in spite of the fact that he doesn't earn a lot. I want to continue my studies, as I'd stopped due to a lack of money. For this reason I'm asking for a loan that will serve to finish my bachelor's degree in nursing. My desire is to work in the best hospital in the country to provide my services to patients, especially to children. My personal dream is to be a good example and an inspiration to my two children so that when they finish secondary school they will have the desire to be professionals.

loans.use: to cover her higher education expenses

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis  tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre con la mujer tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos. 

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Luis Alfredo se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas, cerdos y a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para comprar de insumos agricolas como fertilizantes abonos, etc para la siembra de maiz.Con el apoyo del crédito podrá aumentar la cosecha. 

El sueño es tener su negocio propio.En su tiempo libre le gusta caminar y dormir.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old and is in a common law marriage. He has two children aged 5 and 3 with his partner in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. 

Cevallos Communal Bank is located in the rural community of San Francisco, in the parish of San Juan de Pueblo Viejo. Its members make a living in agricultural work.

Luis Alfredo makes a living from raising animals like chickens and pigs, and in agriculture. He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, manure, etc., for planting corn. He will be able to increase his harvest with the support of the loan. 

His dream is to have his own business. In his free time he likes to walk and to sleep.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La socia Ingrid se dedica al negocio de transporte, la socia tiene una combi donde hace servicio público a diferentes personas y diferentes lugares, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un carro nuevo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Ingrid earns a living through a transportation business. She has a van where she offers a public service for different people and different locations.

She's already been in this business for several years and it's going very well. Her dream is to have a new vehicle.

Ingrid is seeking the loan to buy tires for her vehicle. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for her vehicle.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern is 56 years old, married, and has five children. She is from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  For the last 20 years, she and her husband have been farming rice. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day.

Soern’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is leading her group to request a loan. Soern will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Rosa Juana

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo de 11 años, vive con el esposo y con el hijo  en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Rosa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la críanza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la siembra de maiz. El sueño tener su propio negocio.

En su tiempo libre le gusta dormir y los que haceres domesticos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has an 11-year-old son and lives with her partner and son in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. The Cevallos community bank is located in the town of San Francisco, in the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo Parish. Its members make a living in agricultural work.

Rosa makes a living in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She also makes a living by raising animals like chickens and pigs. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea. With the support of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs to plant corn. Her dream is to have her own business. In her free time she likes to sleep and do housework.

loans.use: to buy what she needs to plant corn

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirley works hard to support her family. Unfortunately, on November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

Shirley has restarted her rice retailing business and is now requesting a PHP 9720 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, 31 years old, has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 12 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Over time, she has become very skilled in the art of embroidery. 

She has three children and she uses the income on their health and education. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to buy reels of threads, sequins, beads and needles. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers on time, and to generate good amount of income.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads, sequins, beads and needles.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sim is 56 years old, and married with two children, one of whom is dependent on her. For the last thirty years, Sim has been growing rice. Together, they can earn about KHR 26,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 6,000 each day for future needs. 

Sim’s group consists of two members and she is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields, so as to increase her family’s income for a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 50 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Sonia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, age 44, is a rice farmer. She has earned her living in this way for the past 20 years. She can earn about 46,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. She and her husband have four children and live in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district in the province of Battambang.
 
This is the first loan for Chorn with Kiva partner VisionFund. As the leader of this group of borrowers, she will use one portion of the loan funds to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for her farmland, and she will use another portion of it to pay for land plowing. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice more successfully, allowing her to produce more rice. This will permit her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, as well as to pay for land plowing

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen, a 42-year-old married mother of six, has been selling milk for the past four years. The owner of three cows, she sells milk to many of her neighbors and other people in her community. Her business is doing well enough to allow her to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family.

Now in her fourth year with Kashf Foundation, Ameen, who is very motivated to provide her children with every possible advantage, has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase another cow. She dreams of improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Outt

texts.en: A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Chhoeng Prey district, Outt is 39 years old, and married with four children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice for 21 years. Outt’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain their banana crop

loans.name: Mujeres De Chuanoj Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Mujeres de Chuanoj” is located in Chuanoj, a rural area in Totonicapan, Guatemala. It is composed of ten women who are applying for a new loan cycle through KIVA. The ladies are involved in various businesses such as animal husbandry, retail sales (snacks, traditional clothing) and textile production (weaving). They are most grateful to be able to access capital in the form of the small loans so that they can maintain and expand their small businesses and generate enough income to support their families.

The Secretary of the trust bank is 28 year old Cecilia. She is married and has four children who range in age from three to eleven. Cecilia fabricates traditional skirts called “cortes” on a foot loom. In order to meet the demand of her customers, she has hired three additional people from Chuanoj. She provides enough fabric and thread to her employees so that they can work efficiently.  Cecilia needs another loan in order to purchase a large quantity of thread and other supplies. She wants her business to move forward!

Cecilia is excited to be part of Mujeres de Chuanoj Trust Bank because, besides having access to loans, the ladies gain valuable business and personal tools each month when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares relevant information with them. The ladies learn about how to manage their loans with discussions about effective business management practices. They learn about how to most effectively take care of their families with new information about nutrition, hygiene, and health. They understand how best to get their children ready for school. And, they learn how to use the medicinal plants that might be growing right in their own neighborhoods! Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

The women of the Trust Bank “Mujeres de Chuanoj” are grateful to KIVA investors for their generosity and kindness in funding their small loans. The ladies are able to provide a higher standard of living for their families as well as additional opportunities including education. KIVA investors are valuable partners in this effort!

loans.use: to buy a good amount of thread and other materials for textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy rice, salt, red oil, onions, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ronald Daniel

texts.es: Ronald de 23 años de edad es soltero y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres. Ronald es un joven muy emprendedor quien desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de tilapia. Ronal tiene muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ronald desea invertir en su negocio de tilapia con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de más tilapias y concentrado para su alimentación y así poder seguir su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Ronald is 23 years old, is single and lives in his own house together with his parents. Ronald is a very enterprising youth who for the past 8 years has worked growing and selling tilapia. Ronald has many clients who prefer him more all the time. Ronald wants to invest in his tilapia business with the goal of increasing his sales and profits. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of more tilapia and concentrated feed. In this way he can continue with his business which is his principal source of income.

loans.use: to buy tilapias (fish) and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to by a solar panel to install in his home

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Heang is a 38-year-old mother of three children. For the last 18 years, she and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. To better support the family, she also works as a paid worker. The current business earns her about USD 17 per day.

Heang is just with VisionFund for this cycle, and now she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and to use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old house. She hopes to increase her crop yields, so as to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland, and to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Jackelinne Benita

texts.es:
Jackeline es una mujer de 42 años de edad casada y madre de 2 hijos. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio con artículos de primera necesidad que atiende todos los días de semana, en la zona de Pampahasi distante a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella es de estatura mediana cabello castaño y piel morena, es de carácter amigable y muy buena atención al cliente, como cada año ya se acerca la fiesta patronal de su barrio y Jackeline sabe que tiene que estar preparada para esa fecha, cientos de bailarines desfilan danzando por las calles al son de bombos y tambores, la gente saca sillas en las puertas de su casa para ver las danzas. Cada grupo de bailarines descansa aproximadamente 15 minutos por hora bailada, las tiendas se ven llenas de personas en busca de; refrescos, helados y todo aquello que pueda saciar su sed y calor, Jackeline necesita comprar y abastecer los insumos de su tienda para ese día, los beneficios que genere los utilizará para la alimentación y estudio de sus dos hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Jackeline solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda y con los beneficios para los gastos de alimentación y estudios de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Her business is a neighborhood store with items of basic need that is open every day of the week in the Pampahasi area, twenty minutes from the center of the city of La Paz.

She is of medium height and has brown hair and skin. She is friendly and has very good customer service. Each year, as the festival for her neighborhood's patron saint approaches, Jackeline knows that she has to be prepared for that day; hundreds of dancers parade, dancing in the streets to the sounds of drums. People bring chairs out to the doors of their houses to see the dances. Each group of dancers rests approximately 15 minutes for each hour danced. The shops are full of people in search of drinks, ice cream and everything that can satiate their thirst and heat; Jackeline needs to buy and stock her store's supplies for that day. She will use the profits she earns for food and studies for her two children.

For this reason Jackeline is asking for a loan to stock her store, and she will use the profits for the expenses for her children's food and studies.

loans.use: to stock her store, and she will use the profits for the expenses for her children's food and studies.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is married with one child who goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, and bags of maize flour. She works in her shop seven days out of every week, and sells on retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and transportation. She is aspiring to own a delivery to ease in transportation, and also to own a fully stocked retail shop. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, salt, soap, rice and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia,  Tucurrique

Ligia lives in a rural area in which there are huge problems with sources of work. Having to support the household budget, they generate income through the sale of products that they have created. They are dedicated to the sewing and principle fabrication of covers for strollers to keep babies from getting wet during the rain. She lives with her husband and 2 young children. She works as a volunteer at the Red Cross in Tucurrique and sells her product in Cartago and Turrialba. 

This new loan is very important for her profession since they already have plans to carry out production to complete the orders of their clients, which have increased due to the start of the rainy season. 

This is her second credit. They already have equipment and a steady market.  Their product is high quality and comes with very good references in the area. With the previous credit, they demonstrated an excellent conduct of payment.  They have acquired raw material and hope to continue to grow, as well as support their children’s studies. 

Ligia has 10 years of experience with sewing machines and her product is very high quality. In addition, she took classes in business administration and has a good understanding of the money in her activity.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to support her production of strollers

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Proyectadas Al Fututro Group

texts.en:
Planning for the Future
Costa Rica, Tucurrique

The group maintains a good track record of repayment and this is their third loan request. They always attend the monthly meeting and collect savings. The associates are already established in their chosen profession and, with the loan, they can strengthen the business.

They have paid on time because they have accepted the responsibility and commitment of payment. The associates of the bank see Fundacion Mujer as a possibility to obtain economic resources.

Mrs. Ariety is integral to the group. She takes care of and grooms nails, a job that she has run in her house in a community east of the central valley in Costa Rica. It is a rural community with few sources of employment. She cares for her clients by painting their nails and working on their feet. She lives with her husband and two young children who attend school. She is going to use the loan to buy polish and other products for foot care. 

This loan allows her and her two partners to improve the businesses through which they support their families. This group helps you keep your business up and running and offers the possibility to contribute to the development of the community.

loans.use: to buy polish and other products for her foot care business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has three buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children, and three of them are going to school. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She uses most of the income to pay for her children’s health and education. It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan, and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay foragricultural supplies and technical assistance for a plantain project.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 52-year-old married woman. She has three children. She has been successfully running a small grocery shop at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field. Over time, the customer base of her store has greatly increased. 

Rasheeda is very thankful for her previous loans. She is in her eighth loan cycle. Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. With this loan she wants to buy stock of packaged milk, biscuits, rice, oil, flour etc. With the help of the income generated from her store, Rasheeda has been able to provide her family with good living conditions. She wants to earn more income, which she wants to spend on the health and comfort of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of packaged milk, biscuits, rice, oil, flour etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, comenta que es de profesión fotógrafo, y que desde pequeño tuvo mucho interés en la fotografía, de lo cual hizo su profesión, y con lo cual está ganándose la vida.
Hoy se trazó la meta de estudiar y capacitarse para poder montar un propio estudio fotográfico, y de esa forma ser un fotógrafo profesional y seguir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder realizar un curso y capacitarse para poder crecer y salir adelante. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Angel is from the city of Caaguazú.  He says that he is a photographer by profession.  As a child, he had a great interest in photography and decided to make it his profession.  This is how he earns his living. 
Today his goal is to study and receive training so that he can establish his own photography studio.  This will help him to become a professional photographer and keep growing.  Angel is requesting this loan so that he can take a course and receive training, which will allow him to grow and move forward.  He is grateful for the opportunity he has received so that he can grow.

loans.use: to pay for a photography course and receive training.

loans.name: Ruby Leah

texts.en:
Ruby Leah is 31 years old and married with one child who is in school. Ruby Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby Leah's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ruby Leah has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ruby Leah has taken a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ruby Leah is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis es un gran ejemplo para su familia, pues desde hace mucho tiempo decidió ser independiente y comenzó a buscar oportunidades para salir adelante y progresar al lado de su esposa (Ver Foto) y sus hijos.
El tomo un negocio de producción de arepas que tenia la familia de su esposa y que poco a poco fueron abandonando; el vio allí la oportunidad de su vida y decidió tomar el negocio y no dejarlo caer.
Es así como viene desempeñándose exitosamente en este negocio.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que sus arepas las vende en todo el municipio de Andes caminando y esto hace que su trabajo sea muy agotador y poco eficiente.
Con la motocicleta podrá acelerar el tiempo de entrega de sus productos y mejorara sus ventas de una manera considerable.
Al apoyar a este emprendedor hombre estarían apoyando el empuje y verraquera colombianos.
texts.en:
Luis is a great role model in his family. A long time ago he decided to become independent and started to look for opportunities in order to prosper and progress with his wife (in the photo) and children.

Luis took on his wife's family's business making "arepas" - a type of pastry - that her family did not want. Luis saw in this business the opportunity of a lifetime and took on the business and did not allow it to close.

The business is now successful.

Luis is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle. As Luis sells the "arepas" across all of the Andes municipality, delivering them on foot has become exhausting and inefficient.

With a motorcycle, Luis can speed up delivery times and increase his sales considerable.

By supporting this enterprising man, you would be supporting the drive and enthusiasm that Colombians have.

loans.use: to buy a motorcyle for delivering "arepas" (a type of pastry).

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es:
A sus 24 años de edad Juan se dedicó a seguir los pasos de su padre pues tiene una chatarrería pues desde muy joven siempre salía del colegio directo al negocio de su padre a trabajar y conseguir dinero para darse sus gustos y comprarse sus propios juguetes. Juan siempre ha sido muy independiente y muy perseverante a la hora de trazarse una meta.
Solicita un crédito para tener capital disponible para la compra de acero, cobre y aluminio lo cual es su principal fuerza de trabajo con ello podrá comprar en grandes cantidades para sacarle un mejor provecho a estos materiales. 
Su principal sueño es tener un negocio rentable duplicar su venta en un periodo de 5 años y ayudar a su madre económicamente
texts.en:
Juan, who is 24 years old, decided to follow in his father's footsteps and has a scrap metal business. From a very young age he used to go straight from school to work in his father's business so he could have money to spend on what he wanted and buy his own toys. Juan has always been very independent and perseverant  when setting a goal for himself.

He is asking for a loan in order to have capital available to buy steel, copper and aluminium, which makes up the bulk of his work. With the loan he will be able to buy it in large quantities so he can make more profit from these materials.

His main dreams are to have a profitable business, to double his sales in a five-year period and to help his mother financially.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy copper, aluminium and steel.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 32 years old. She is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more maize and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Eslendy

texts.es:
Eslendy, una joven con gran energía y entusiasmo termino una Técnica en Guía Turística en el municipio de Santa Elena.
Desde ese momento decidió que quería montar una agencia de viajes y aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos.
Por ésta razón es que solicita un préstamo, pues quiere montar una oficina de viajes en su propia casa y el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de uniformes y publicidad.
Manifiesta que es una carrera que le apasiona mucho y que le gustaría dedicarse a este trabajo.
Uno de sus mayores sueños es poder ser independiente y generar sus propios ingresos para poder llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en: Eslendy is a young woman with lots of energy and enthusiasm. She worked as a specialist in tourism in the Santa Elena municipality. Since that moment she decided that she wanted to start a tourism agency and apply her acquired knowledge. For this reason, she is requested a loan because she wants to open a travel office in her own home. The money will be invested in the purchase of uniforms and advertising. She says that it is a career that she is very passionate about and will generate enough income to be a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and advertising for her tourism agency

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a food kiosk to sell her meals, since it is the only source of income she has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and improve the pasture to feed them.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Norm, 54, lives with her family members in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She has three children, who are still in school. For the last 34 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day.

This is the second loan for Norm with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy, 39, is married mother living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She has four children and to support her living expenses, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for 21 years. With her hard work, she manages to earn about 29,000 KHR per day and can save about 14,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the first loan for Hoy with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan and she will use a portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to spend on pesticides and labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for labor for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling milk for last five years. She has two buffalos and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffalos, performs the task of collecting milk from them, and her husband sells it at different places on a daily basis. In this way she obtains decent profits. She uses the income to support her family. She has two children going to school. In order to make more profits, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes that this loan will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for her milk business.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.en: Ranokhon is 46 years old.  She is divorced and bringing up three children. Ranokhon is a very hardworking woman. She has a medical education and she works in a local hospital as a nurse. She is the only provider for her family because her children are not adults. Ranokhon and her children live poorly because her salary is small. She is going to repair her house as it is bad condition, but she has not enough money to do it. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en: Saboat is married and has three children who are adults. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. She is widowed; her husband died some years ago. She decided to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. Saboat studied at the course "To Get Ahead" of a women's organization and gained enough skills about business. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy cattle to organize the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to organize a new business

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is a 27-year-old young woman from Zugdidi district. She lives with her husband and two kindergarten-aged sons. Their family's only source of income is Khatia's husband's job and he generates 300 GEL per month. This income is really hardly enough for a family of four to meet their basic needs and cover their daily costs. Khatia is eager to help her husband, more effectively lead the family, and provide a good education to her children. 

Khatia requested a loan from MFO Credo, which gives a chance to people to be involved in their own businesses within the start-up program.  Khatia decided to purchase refrigerators, an oven, and other working materials to open a cafe in her city. She thinks that this business will be profitable because of its location. Her regular costumers will be locals and passers-by. This cafe will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the start-up program Khatia will be able to save and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: To open a cafe

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a single mother of five children, four of whom go to school, has operated a beauty salon for 10 years. She resides in the family house where they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Betty works from home seven days a week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges Include seasonality and thieves. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care and is now requesting a loan of 1200000 Uganda shillings to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair oils, braids and weaves.

Betty aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and hopes to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair oils, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Yao

texts.en: Yao has been selling soap for the past year in Lomé, the capital of Togo. He is 42 years old and lives with his wife, also a retailer, and their one-year-old child. Yao will use this 300,000 XOF loan to increase his stock of soaps. This will be Yao’s first loan with WAGES. In the future, he hopes to use his profits to reinvest in his business so that he can sell in multiple locations, and to assure that his family’s needs are fully provided for.

loans.use: to buy soap for resale

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is 41 years old. She is a mother of six children. She sells beans and maize. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize.

loans.name: Sroun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sroun is 53 years old and married with three children. For the last 33 years, Sroun has been growing rice to make a living, earning about 27,000 KHR per day.

Sroun’s group consists of two members and she has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle. Sroun successfully used the past loan from VisionFund to better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for another loan, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to increase family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, salt, red oil, union, fish etc

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with thatched walls in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Mom is 58 years old and married with four children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava.

Mom is just with VisionFund for this loan cycle. And now she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her current business so as to increase her family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Elsad

texts.en: Elsad, 24 years old, raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But he must borrow water from a neighbor each time he waters his land. Elsad needs your financial support. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy tools and to build a sluiceway (a water channel). Elsad is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for this loan.

loans.use: to buy tools and to build a sluiceway

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (rice, salt, red oil, onions, etc)

loans.name: Zarife

texts.en:
Zarife wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped her to purchase windows and door frames to improve the living conditions and the family's overall health during the cold and rainy seasons. She is very satisfied with the loan process and the results that she has enjoyed thanks to the loan. 

She is once again requesting a loan to repair and address the problems and condition of her toilet. With this loan, she will continue to improve her family’s lives and their standard of living, a dream that she had always had. She hopes in the future that she will be able to find a job and contribute to the finances of her family, and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To repair and address the problems and condition of her toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough food (such as cassava, salt, meat, etc.)

loans.name: Tozagul

texts.en:
Tozagul is widowed. She is careful mother of three children. Tozagul is only feed keeper of her children. She lives with her children in the south part of Tajikistan. 

She has been busy selling children's clothes for more than five years. She sells children's clothes in a local market where she has a store. She manages the business alone. 

Tozagul is going to buy children's clothes for the new season, and in this way attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni with this aim. 

Tozagul is going to improve their living condition with the profit from her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the new season

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a 25-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Hannatu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hannatu can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hannatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Hannatu said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Elkana, Lydia, and Steven, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Hannatu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality supplies such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Дилбар 55 - летняя жительница района Спитамен. Она замужем. Дилбар является матерью двоих взрослых детей. Дилабар занимается животноводством. Она на протяжении пятнадцати лет разводит скот у себя дома. В теплое время года она отправляет скот на пастбище. В этом ей помогает ее сын. 
Дилбар берет кредит для закупа телят. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Dilbar is a 55-year-old resident of the Spitamen district. She is married. Dilbar is a mother of two adult children. Dilbar is involved in animal husbandry. She has been breeding livestock at home for fifteen years. She sends livestock to a pasture during the warm season. Her son helps her with this business. Dilbar is requesting this loan to buy calves. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka is 58 years of age, married and mother of four kids. She   is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her husband   in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Maleyka    has been raising cattle for the past 16 years. Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle, and she also sells cheese, yogurt, butter and milk at the market. This is the only source of income for the family. From this business her monthly profit is 150 Azn. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. 

She has applied for a loan of   1300 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. She has plans of expanding the business to meet the high potential for milk in the market. This is her first  credit.  Maleyka    appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Qizlarkhon

texts.ru: Кизлархон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем, живет с родителями. Кизлархон занимается торговлей. По мере возможности ей помогают ее родители. Кизлархон работает во благо своих родителей. Она берет кредит для приобретения продуктов, чтобы увеличить оборот и получить хорошую прибыль от продажи. Также создать необходимые условия в доме. Улучшить свою жизнь, чтобы ее родители ни в чем не нуждались.
texts.en: Qizlarkhon lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 20 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Qizlarkhon is involved in sales. Her parents help her as their availability permits. Qizlarkhon works for the welfare of her parents. She is requesting this loan to buy products in order to increase her turnover and earn a good profit from sales. She also wants to create necessary conditions at home and improve her life, so that her parents were not in need for anything.

loans.use: to buy products in order to increase her turnover, all for the welfare of her parents and hers

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 42 years old. Her husband works in customs at the port in Lomé, the capital of Togo, where the couple lives with their three children.

Louise is seeking a second loan in order buy more cereals, which she sells at the market. This will be Louise's second loan with WAGES. Her first loan has been fully repaid. Louise plans to use the money to further increase her stock and grow her profits. She hopes to continue working to improve her family's livelihood with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Ayele Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 51-year-old single mother of two grown children, one of whom is still in school. For the past 20 years, she has been selling charcoal and grain from her home. She is seeking a second loan from WAGES of 150,000 FCFA in order to increase her stock of charcoal and grain. Her first loan was fully repaid. In the future, Josephine hopes that she will be able to continue helping her children pursue higher education.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and grain for resale

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en: Kodjo is a single, 34-year-man with one child who is currently in school. Since 2002, he has run a shop in the market selling men’s jeans. Kodjo is seeking his first loan of 400,000 XOF in order to purchase more stock for his store. The additional profits from this loan will allow Kodjo to reinvest in his business. He would eventually like to open more shops in order to better provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy jeans for resale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 54-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in banana planting for many years in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from an alcohol brewing business. Lawrence started his business to get more income to educate his children. He lacks capital to expand his banana plantation farm to serve the surrounding urban centre market and to pay workers. Lawrence is requesting a loan to pay for labor for weeding his banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labor for weeding his banana plantation.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is married and has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. For the past 5 years, Peris has operated a retail business selling maize and beans. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. Peris will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a large store within 5 years. Peris hopes that, in the future, she will own a large business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electronic items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Maria Antonieta se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,la socia tiene un restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta Works selling food, she has a restaurant and makes different dishes such as oven baked chicken, soups and traditional meat stir fries. She works from 8am until 6pm, she has worked in the business for eight years and it is going very well for her. 

She is asking for the loan to buy cooking ingredients like rice, vegetables and chicken. She is happy to get a loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a 35-year-old farmer from Tawakiri. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu can earn up to USD 2,000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Saratu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Martha, Emma, and Ado, and in five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a 42-year-old housewife from the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Shyamal who is 47 years old. They have one son and he is in school now in grade three. They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).

Anjana’s husband is associated with the business of furniture making. He prepares wooden furniture like chairs, tables, cabinets, racks etc. according to the demands of his customers.  His main customers are his neighbors. He buys wood from the wholesale market for manufacturing furniture. This business is the main source of creating income for maintaining the family's expenses. Anjana assists her husband in his business after managing her household work.

Now he wants to extend his business. He wants to buy more wood and other materials for making furniture. But he does not have enough capital. 
Thus, Anjana decided to help her husband. She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She hopes this loan will help her husband to increase his business. She also hopes their financial status will be upgraded with the profit from the business.   

She and her husband thank her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: To purchase woods and other essential materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil to sell.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru:
Турсуной жительница района Носири Хусрав. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Турсуной работает на рынке. Она занимается торговлей овощей. Турсуной уже год занимается торговлей. 
Турсуной берет кредит для покупки дыни, арбуза и овощей, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Так как она недавно начала торговать, у нее мало товара, чтобы продать имеющий товар ей необходимо увеличить его ассортимент.
texts.en: Tursunoy is a resident of the Nosiri Khusrav. She is 37 years old. She is married and has one child. Tursunoy works at a market. She is involved in selling vegetables. Tursunoy has been involved in this business for one year. Tursunoy is requesting this loan to buy cantaloupes, watermelons and vegetables to increase her turnover. Because she recently started in this business, she does not have a lot of product and needs to expand her selection in order to sell her existing products.

loans.use: to buy cantaloupes, watermelons and vegetables to increase her turnover

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбару 38 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж работает плотником. Они воспитывают двоих детей, им 5 и 7 лет. Муж Санавбара много работает, чтобы обеспечить жену и детей. Санавбар тоже много работает, она хранительница домашнего и уюта в доме. Она занимается всеми домашними делами, следит за детьми, а так же в огороде выращивает овощи. Деятельностью растениеводством она справляется на ура. Санавбар таким образом экономить деньги на еду и часть урожая она продает и получает хорошую выгоду. Сейчас Санавбару не хватает средств, чтобы закончить посев урожая. Она на заемные деньги приобретет бобовые семена и полезные минеральные удобрения для обработки урожая.
texts.en: Sanavbar is 38 years old. She is married. Her husband works as a carpenter. They are raising two children, who are 5 and 7 years old. Sanavbar's husband works a lot to provide for his wife and children. Sanavbar also works a lot - she is the guardian of the house and comfort at home. She is involved in all of the household work, watches the children and also grows vegetables in the garden. She handles the gardening activity successfully. This way Sanavbar is able to save money on food and sells part of the harvest, and earns a good profit. Now Sanavbar does not have enough money to finish the sowing of the next crop. She will use this loan to purchase bean seeds and useful mineral fertilizers to treat the crop.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 12 años y 16 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Rosa es una mujer valiente, trabajadora y sobre todo visionaria. Ella trabaja en una finca en diferentes labores, en el mismo lugar trabada su esposo y juntos llevan el sustento diario. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo, hacer una división de un cuarto y para reparar la cocina. Con e monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y pines.
texts.en: Rosa is 55 years old and lives with his partner and two children ages 12 and 16 that are currently in school. Rosa is a brave, hardworking woman who's a visionary above all. She performs a variety of jobs at the same plantation where her husband works, and together they support their household. With the aim of improving her living conditions she's requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in roof repair, build a division in a room and fix the kitchen. She'll buy galvanized metal, wood and nails with the requested amount.

loans.use: To purchase: galvanized metal, wood and nails to repair the roof, build a division and fix the kitchen.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 26-year-old man who is married but not blessed with a child yet. He has been running a butcher shop for the last five years but he also practices farming on his farm as a secondary business. From the two businesses, Samuel is able to make a profit of about KES 25,000, which is able to provide for his family's needs.

Samuel has applied for his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to add more stock in the butchery, for resale to his clients. He hopes to make more profits, which he plans to use to repay his loan as well as grow his businesses. In the future, Samuel would like to have a blessed business and family.

loans.use: To add more stock of meat for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be self-committed. She operates a retail business where she sells salt, bread, wheat flour, drinks and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, salt, sugar, flour and other items. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, salt, sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William  runs a retail shop that sells soap, drinks, juice, sugar, rice, cooking oil and other general merchandise. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He practices farming so as to get more income and improve his standard of living. He dreams of buying a car to make transportation of his goods easy.

William intends to use the loan to buy more soap, drinks, juice, sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, drinks, juice, sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jabres

texts.en:
Jabres is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. His business is located in a marketable location and his primary customers are the general public. 

Jabres describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to own a bigger tailoring shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Cavin

texts.en:
Cavin earns an income by operating a tailoring business. He has been involved in his clothes-making activity for three years. His enterprise is located in a viable location, and his primary customers are members of the general public in his community. He reports that his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. He describes himself as an active person. 

Cavin and his wife have one child.

He will use his Kes 20,000 loan to buy a stock of tailoring materials. His professional goal is to own a big clothing shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business and a thriving home. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a 30-year-old farmer from Kwankwani.  As a Babban Gona member, Saratu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Saratu said: “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children, Nathan, Pamela, and Nehemiah, and in five years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double her  income and yield

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima hails from a small village of Maynaguri.  She is a married woman with five sons.  Four of them are students and one works as a daily laborer who has no fixed income.  They live in a small village of Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. Purnima and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  They did not get an opportunity to study as their family could not provide it.

Purnima's husband Khagendra, age 52, is a farmer by profession.  He grows seasonal vegetables on his farmland.  He sells his produce in the local market.  He has been engaged in this business for many years.  For the last two years, his business has not been going well.  The soil in their area is so productive and fertile that most of the common and poor people are engaged in agribusinesses. As a result, he had to face many competitors. 
So, being the sole breadwinner, it was difficult for him to cover all the necessities of a seven-member family.  Purnima then started livestock breeding with the purchase of one dairy cow.  She is active and diligent.  She sells milk to her neighbors.  She gives great financial support to their family.

In order to expand her business for better income, she wants to purchase one more dairy cow.  So she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She hopes the loan will help her to earn more to reach her goals. She wants to give economic stability to her family and educate their children to become professionals in the future.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen works hard to support her family. She is 50 years of age and married. She assists her husband in running a general store at their house. They have been running this store for the past 20 years. She has seven children. Most of their income is spent on the well-being of their children. 

Perveen is in her fifth loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will be used to purchase spools of thread, shampoo and edibles like buns, tea, packed milk and other goods. She wants to expand the business to earn more income and spend it on her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, shampoo and edibles like buns, tea, packed milk and other goods.

loans.name: Zaynabby

texts.ru:
На фотографии Зайнаббй с невесткой. Невестку зовут Насиба. Они живут на районе Хамадони. Муж Зайнаббй дехканин, у него имеется участок земли, на котором сажает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он большую часть времени проводит на земле. Сын Зайнаббй находиться за приделами страны на заработках. Его жена Насиба живет в Таджикистане и присматривает за старыми родителями мужа. 
  Зайнаббй 59 лет, она занимается шитьем и вышиванием национальной женской одежды. Все свое мастерство и умение она хочет передать Насибе. Насиба только начинает учиться, и хочет научиться шить не только национальные, но все виды одежды. Насиба надеется научиться всем тонкостям данной деятельности и получать заказы на шитье и таким  образом принести в семью источник дохода. Чтобы начать собственный бизнес Насибе необходимо купить собственную швейную машинку. Зайнаб полностью поддерживает невестку и всячески помогает, и хочет помочь ей купить швейную машинку от средств кредита. Поддержите Зайнаббй и Насибу.
texts.en: This is a picture of Zaynabby and her daughter-in-law Nasiba.  They live in the Hamadoni region of Tajikistan.  Zaynabby's husband is a dekhan farmer; he has a plot of land all his own for growing crops, and spends most of his time working the fields.  Zaynabby's son is a migrant worker abroad.  Nasiba, his wife, lives in Tajikistan and looks after her husband's aging parents.  Zaynabby is 59 and works as a seamstress making Tajikistani women's clothing for a living.  She wants to impart all of her skill and ability to Nasiba.  Nasiba has only just started to learn from Zaynabby, and wants to learn how to make not only Tajikistani clothing, but clothing in general as well.  Nasiba is hoping to learn her new trade down to the minor details and be able to earn money for her family by doing so.  Zaynabby is behind her 100%, and is seeking a loan to buy a sewing machine for Nasiba.  Please do what you can to support them.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law so she can learn to be a seamstress

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old and supports eight members in his family. He is married to Rosebelle who provides additional income for the family. Their children are above two years.

Emmanuel sells vegetables and fruits, a business he has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 1,000.

Emmanuel has requested his second loan of KES 10,000 which he will use to add stock of vegetables for sale. With the anticipated profits, Emmanuel will be able to improve the living standards of his family. His hopes and dreams are to expand the business into further growth.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара образованная женщина. Она родилась в 1970 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одну 5 летнюю дочь. Гулсара уже более 11 год работает в средней школе. Она учительница.  Гулсара обратилась за займом в ИМОН, так как ее дочь родилась с проблемами в бедре и ей срочно необходимо сделать операцию. Она собрала немного денег, но это не достаточно. Гулсара запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для операции дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulsara is an educated woman. She was born in 1970. She is married and raising a 5-year-old daughter. Gulsara has been working at a secondary school for over 11 years. She is a teacher. Gulsara requested a loan from IMON because her daughter was born with hip problems and needs to urgently have a surgery. Gulsara saved some money, but it is not enough. Gulsara is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni for her daughter's surgery. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's surgery

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en: Augustin is married and has 8 children. He describes himself to be focused. For the past 13 years, Augustin has operated a retail business selling Agrovet products. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. Augustin will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of Agrovet products. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, his life will be different. Augustin will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Agrovet products

loans.name: Mubaroy

texts.ru: Мубарой порядочная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Мубарой как заботливая мать начала свой бизнес выпечкой и продажей кондитерских изделий как самбуса, пирожное, печенье, пирожки и т.п. Ее лавочка находится близко школе и поэтому школьники являются ее постоянными покупателями. Мубарой данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она больна и ей срочно не обходимо лечится. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mubaroy is a decent woman. She is married and raising 4 children. As a caring mother, Mubaroy started a business of baking and selling baked goods, such as samosa, pastries, cookies, pies, etc.  Her small store is located near a school, and this is why school children are her regular customers. Mubaroy needs financial assistance now because she is ill and urgently needs to seek treatment. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy medicine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen, age 48, saw her business and home destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has since restarted her fish vending business, and she is committed to regaining what she lost. 

Belen and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.
 
She requested a PhP 9,720 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Belen has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

In the future, Belen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family

loans.name: Jesus Deliva

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 59 años de edad es madre soltera tiene una hija, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Jesús se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras y ventas las realiza en Ventanas.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente es la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener su negocio propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con la hija por el pueblo.
texts.en: Jesus is the 59 year old single mother of one daughter and lives in Canton Ventanas Provincia de los Rios. She's a member of VRC Cevallos and is located in the San Francisco Precinct, part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish which is an area of agricultural work. Jesus works in agriculture, namely rice planting. She's requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, and fertilizers. With the aid of the loan she'll be able to buy necessary things for agriculture. Ventanas is where she does her buying and selling. The challenges that frequently arise are competition and crop diseases. Her dream is to have her own business. In her free time she enjoys taking strolls in town with her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, 42 years old, has operated a business selling foodstuffs for the past six years. She wants to use this loan to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, beans and lotions for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as rice, beans and lotions for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Agateraine Business Ladies Group

texts.en:
Betty is a 48-year-old female living in Masindi Uganda. She is married with four children aged between 14 and 20 years. She started business so as to fulfill the family's needs. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs and bad roads since she operates her business in a remote area.

She wants a loan to buy more timber to sell.

Betty is a member of Agateraine Business Ladies group where members guarantee each other to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy more timber to sell.

loans.name: Saratu Uwani

texts.en: Saratu Uwani remembers not being able to feed her family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Saratu Uwani, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000 per hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags per hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu Uwani is ambitious and is aiming to reap 36 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Saratu Uwani.  With this loan, Saratu Uwani is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double her income and yield.

loans.name: Gilmar

texts.es:
El socio Gilmar se dedica al negocio de agencia de viajes,el socio trabaja con personas extranjeras y nacionales, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: our member Gilmar runs a travel agency where he works with both foreign and Peruvian people. He works from 8am until 6pm. He has worked in the business for a number of tears and things are going very well for him. His dream is to expand his travel agency. Gilmar is applying for the loan to buy travel tickets.  He is pleased to receive the loan and promises to pay it back in full.

loans.use: To buy travel tickets.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, age 41, practices cash crop farming to earn an income. He has been engaged in this activity for the past 10 years, and he is currently able to obtain a monthly profit of 15,000 Kenya shillings, which enables him to cater to his family's needs.

He and his wife have three children, ages two, six, and eight years old.

Stephen has applied for his second loan, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the next planting season. He is confident that he will make good returns so that he can use the extra income to repay his loan and provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man. He has three children, ranging in age from four to nine years. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a dairy farm where he keeps cows, which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the locals who live there. He will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy more farm inputs. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will become a better businessperson. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 38 years old. She is a mother of six children aged between five and twenty years old. With the loan she would like to buy more maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly, age 38, saw her home and her business destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Beverly has since restarted her recycled materials business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.  

She and her husband have two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Beverly requested a PhP 9,866.60 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials with which to rebuild her family home. She will use her loan funds to buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

Beverly is committed to rebuilding her family's devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
WONDERFUL LENDERS! Meet Sarah, from the Kitale area of Kenya, which is a cosmopolitan town where most of the people are very hardworking small scale farmers. Sarah is 57 years old and the proud mother of 9 children. Sarah can be described as very hardworking because feeding 9 stomachs is not easy. However, she has managed to pull through and has always put food on the table for this large family.

Sarah practices mixed farming to make ends meet and, through animal and crop farming, she has been able to get more profits. Sarah sells the fruits of her labor to the nearby market and has been able to build a large customer base. Sarah has been practicing farming for the past 20 years and has gained a wealth of experience. She has been able to face good times and bad times in farming. Although Sarah makes profits, she still faces the challenges of feeding her large family, and so she wants to start a poultry business. Sarah is seeking a loan of KES 45,000 to buy poultry and to be able to increase her income levels. Through increased income levels, Sarah will be sure that her 9 children will get a good education and be able to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 42-year-old married woman. She has eight children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 10 years she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. Shazia buys various fabric types in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then she sells them to the people of her community. She also embroiders as a side job. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. Shazia expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married with five children, four of whom are in school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mupa has operated a clothes selling business for the past four years. She sells door-to-door to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bárbara

texts.es: Bárbara es una persona de 43 años de edad, Casada, tiene cinco hijos, quienes vive en el departamento de Suchitepéquez. La actividad principal es la prestación de servicios de cocina y ama de casa, lleva trabajando más de dos años con una familia que vive dentro de su comunidad, por lo que obtiene un salario mensual para poder ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia y así contribuir a mejorar su calidad de vida. Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción. La meta a corto plazo es poder tener una vivienda digna para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Barbara is 43 years old, married, and has five children whom she lives with in the Department of Suchitepequez. Her primary activity is providing cooking and housekeeping services, and she has been working for over two years with a family that lives in her community. As a result she receives a monthly salary to help support her household and thus contribute to the improvement of her quality of life. She's requesting a loan of Q 10,000.00 to purchase construction materials. The short-term goal is to have a respectable home for the sake of her children's welfare.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jesus Manuel

texts.es: Jesús tiene 24 años de edad y se gana la vida trabajando como auxiliar de albañil desde hace tres años.
