Jesús habita junto a su madre y su tía y por medio de su trabajo logran cubrir los principales gastos del hogar. Jesús desea  mejoras las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y grava para reparar el techo de la vivienda, encementar el piso y para construir una canaleta para las aguas lluvias.
texts.en: 24-year-old Jesus has earned his living as a building assistant for three years. He lives with his mother and his aunt and, with what he earns from his work, the cover the main household expenses. Jesus would like to improve his home and so he is applying to FUSAI for this loan to buy galvanised metal sheeting, wood, cement sand and gravel to repair the roof of his home, cement over the floor and to build guttering for rainwater.

loans.use: to buy galvanised mat petal sheets, wood, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof of his home, cement over the floor and build a gutter for rain water.

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer de 45 años de edad,  es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo y pertenece al grupo La Buena  Amistad, se dedica a la venta de bebidas, golosina y además vende productos de   Esika y Avon, se siente orgullosa de su trabajo porque desde muy joven quiso ser independiente, solicito el préstamo la compra de golosinas para su negocio y agradece a  los inversionista de KIVA porque gracias a ellos muchos emprendedores pueden lograr objetivos y mejorar su calidad de vida  en sus negocios y personales.
texts.en:
Bertha is 45 years old. She lives with a partner and she has a son. She belongs to the group "La Buena Amistad" [Good Friendship], and she makes a living selling beverages and candy, besides selling Esika and Avon [direct sales, cosmetics] products. She is proud of her work, since she has wanted from a very young age to be independent.

She requests the loan to buy candy for her business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them, many entrepreneurs can achieve goals and improve the quality of their businesses and lives.

loans.use: to buy candy, beverages for her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
La socia Eliza se dedica al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia lleva a diferentes lugares o amigos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y elm va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las chompas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eliza makes a living selling sweaters. The member sells from 8:00am to 6:00pm in different places or to friends. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. The member's dream is to have a stall where she can sell the sweaters. The member is requesting the loan to buy sweaters.

The member is happy with the loan and committed to completing the payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps cows, which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a better businessperson. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy sells clothing to earn her living. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are locals.

Lucy is widowed and has six children between the ages of 10 and 18 years old. 

She will use her Kes 20,000 loan funds to buy a stock of clothes to offer for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: buy a stock of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 34-year-old man who is married and blessed with two children aged six and two years old. He has been practicing cash-crop farming for the last 10 years and makes a monthly profit of KES 15,000.

He has applied for his fourth loan, which he plans to use to buy seed and fertilizers in preparation for the planting season. He hopes to make a lot of profit, which he plans to use to pay his loan as well as save towards the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anelen

texts.en:
Anelen is 45 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Anelen works very hard to provide for them.

Anelen's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Anelen has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Anelen has taken a PHP 9833.30 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Anelen is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Bilha, a mother of five children who hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that has good weather patterns that favor crop production and dairy farming. Bilha is 40 years of age and as people would like to say, “life begins at 40.” She has been doing farming for the past six years. The Kitale area is an area with high poultry production and consumption and this has made Bilha come up with a business idea of starting a poultry business. Bilha is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to buy poultry and be able to meet the demand and market that is already there.

Through profits gathered from selling eggs and poultry meat she will be able to fully finance the loan and also support her kids through their entire education system and help them have a much improved lifestyle.

Bilha dreams of opening a large egg-selling shop that will be selling eggs to wholesalers and to retailers. With this kind of shop she is sure that she will get out of the poverty bracket.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica tiene 34 años estado civil unión libre  vive con la pareja y con el hijo en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS. 

Mónica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y soya, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes y asi aumentar el negocio.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. El sueño es tener un negocio propio. El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia y las plagas. En el tiempo libre le guata tejer.
texts.en:
Mónica is 34 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and and child in the Ventanas Provincia De los Rios Canton. The members of VRC Cevallos work in agriculture, it's located in the San Francisco precinct and belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo Parish

Monica works in agriculture, namely planting corn and soy, and in addition she works raising animals such as chickens and pigs. She's requesting a loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers to boost her business.

With the aid of the loan she'll be able to buy what's necessary for agriculture. Her dream is to have her own business. The challenges she faces are competition and plant disease and pests. She enjoys knitting in her free time.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 38 years old.  He is married with four children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells cloth made form textiles. He is also engaged in farming on large scale to enable him to care for the family. With his savings from farming, he decided to start up a textile shop to generate more income. He is seeking a loan to buy more textiles for resale.

He dreams of building a permanent house for his family; but, he is challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for resalel.

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi is a 41-year-old man who is married and blessed with four children aged between nine years old and one year. He has been a cash crop farmer in his area for a period of 10 years and he makes a monthly income of Kenya shillings 20,000  which is enough to cater for his family's needs.

He has taken his third loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to use this money to buy some seeds and fertilizers as well as pay for labor in his family. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and in future he would like to save and educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy some farm inputs including seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 10 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, washing soap and other household-use items. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are locals. 

Jane will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other household goods. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other household-use items

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Carol's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Carol is taking out a PHP 9,286.60 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Carol has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Carol would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Chiengkonpang K Group

texts.en:
These hardworking tribal women call themselves by the group name “Chiengkonpang K”. They all live in the outskirts of a village in the state of Manipur, which is in the northeastern part of India. They formed the group in 2014, with an aim to generate income for themselves by accessing a loan. 

Khuolneiting is one of the eight members of the group and is pictured with a raised hand. She is 51 years old and is a mother to two children. Her two kids are in college. Khuolneiting’s husband is a carpenter by profession. He builds houses and furniture around the area. Her husband’s activity could not be of much significance for supplementing the family income. Therefore, she decided to open a general store to help generate more income for the family. Khuolneiting sells general items such as pan, cigarettes, cereals, lentils, sugar, cold drinks, etc. 

With her profits, she wants to expand her store by increasing her inventory. She is happy that she could now help her children in paying their college fees and educational expenses without depending on her husband. Now she manages the daily needs of the family with her income and saves her husband’s daily earnings down to a rupee. She also employs two people to help her in running the store. Khuolneiting, along with her husband, means to provide a good environment and create a sound family atmosphere for the children's education. 

Now, she needs a solar loan for her store business. She wishes to install the 45-watt solar home lighting in her general store so that she could extend her business hours for a longer period after sunset. The light irregularity in her locality is a great hurdle for the income-generating people. More customers flock in after dusk to buy their daily essential needs, which means her business is more profitable past sunset.   

Likewise, the rest of the group members also need a solar loan for their respective income-generating activities. Weaving, a variety store and a pan shop are some of the activities of the group members.

loans.use: to buy a 45-watt solar home lighting system to light up her shop past sunset to run the business for longer hours.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 27 years old and has four children.  Arlene is married and all of her children are in school.

Arlene and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Arlene is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,866.60 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her recycled materials business.

With your help, Arlene can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy goats for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough ingredients for baking such as flour, oil, butter, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Jose Leonardo

texts.es:
José se ha desempeñado su profesión de taxista durante muchos años adquiriendo un gran carisma y servicio al cliente notable por tratar con personas diariamente. 
José quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía como bóxer, camisetas y jeans, los cuales iniciara ofreciéndoselos a sus compañeros de trabajo pues quiere tener un ingreso extra de dinero muy necesario para su familia la cual la conforman su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. 
El credito sera utilizado en la compra de mercancia al por mayor tales como ropa y accesorios de vestir.
Se ha trazado una meta de crecer y ofertar más mercancía en un periodo de 6 meses, con este crédito busca consolidar un negocio para ofrecerle una buena vida a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José is married and has two young children. He has driven a taxi for many years, developing great charm and offering excellent customer service as he's dealt with people each day. 
 
José wants to start business selling clothing, such as boxer shorts, t-shirts, and jeans. He plans to start offering merchandise to his colleagues as he'd like to have additional income that his family needs. He has a wife and two young children. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise like clothing and accessories. José has developed a goal of growing his business and expanding his inventory within six months. He will use the funds from this loan to establish a business to offer a better life for his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise - such as boxer shorts, jeans, shirts, and t-shirts - to start a business selling men's clothing.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married and has four children. She describes herself as creative. She operates a poultry farm where she sells chicken meat and eggs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to be able to sell her products to hotels within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will increase her chickens. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Doricas

texts.en:
Doricas is 53 years old, married to James, and blessed with six children, ages 15 to 29.

Doricas has run a retail shop for the last four years, earning a profit of KES 32,000 per month. She has requested her second loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya to add to her stock of retail products for sale. Such products include margarine, sugar, and oil. 

With the anticipated products, Doricas will be able to expand into wholesale. Her dream is to have her business fully grown.

loans.use: to add retail products.

loans.name: Paso De Patria 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Paso de Patria 1, se formó en la ciudad de Pilar, donde está integrado por 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que están luchando por mejorar sus vidas y las de sus familias por medio del trabajo unido.
Maria es una de ellas, se dedica a la costura, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, está superándose poco a poco y gracias a su sacrificio y lucha.
Mirna pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros insumos, de manera a seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
texts.en:
This group is called Paso de Patria 1 [Path of the Nation 1], and formed when 18 hardworking women in the city of Pilar came together. The members strive diligently to improve their lives and those of their family members by working together. 

Maria is one member of Paso de Patria, and is a talented seamstress with a strong customer base. Maria's sacrifices and hard work are gradually ensuring the success of her business. She is applying for a loan because she wants to purchase fabric, thread, rubber, and other supplies so that she can continue her work as a seamstress. Maria is a hardworking and tenacious woman who strives to provide better living conditions for her family

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, rubber, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JERUSALEN” iniciará el trigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de perfumes, servicio de construcción, taller de carpintería, venta de ropa, venta de chocolate, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eva es integrante, ella indica que  hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, al observar que este negocio lo implemento porque le daba tiempo para cuidar a su hija. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de  enlatados por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jerusalen" will start its 35th loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  They meet in the Santiago II central office.  This group has 9 members, and is led by a board of directors where Eva is the president.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: blanket weaving, vegetable sales, perfume sales, construction services, carpentry, clothing sales, chocolate sales, and meat sales.

The loan that they are taking will benefit al of the small businesspeople in Eva's group.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  At his time, she has a neighborhood store. She has gotten to know this business because she started this business a number of years ago.  She chose this business after she realized that this type of work would allow her to have the time to also care for her daughter.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her capital (to buy canned goods at wholesale). She will acquire these goods from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and later sell them in her store.  By working this way, she can generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training, the loans, and the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy canned goods in bulk

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Sarita Colonia” conformada por 08 socios responsables y emprendedores que buscan crecer cada día.  Isabel de 40 años es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se desempeña como operaria de limpieza pública. Fruto de su esfuerzo puede salir adelante y cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Así mismo tiene planeado poner su propio negocio de abarrotes. Es por ello que  solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche y  aceite. El deseo de Isabel es acondicionar y ampliar su negocio la cual le ayudara llegar a mas clientes. El grupo “Sarita Colonia” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Isabel es la tercera del lado derecho y viste casaca celeste.
texts.en:
The “Sarita Colonia” group has 8 responsible and enterprising members who are looking to grow every day. Isabel, age 40, is separated and has one dependent child. She is a public cleaning person. Thanks to her hard work she is able to get ahead and cover her household costs. She plans to have her own grocery business. She is requesting her loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Isabel desires to improve her business in order to attract more clients. 
The “Sarita Colonia” group is grateful to those who are making this loan possible and promise to keep working well. Isabel is pictured third from the right with the blue jacket.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil for her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 46 years old and married with four children, all in school. She has been crop farming for the last five years and earns a monthly income of KES 19,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES15,000 to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizer. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: El Colegio Sur Group

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 26 años de edad es soltera y madre de 2 hijos. (en la foto ella lleva puesto una blusa amarilla y blanco, sentada al centro)

El mayor de sus hijos se encuentra en la escuela primaria y el menor la acompaña a realizar sus labores diarias. Mariela es de tez morena, cabello rizado y manos grandes, su negocio es la venta de comida de forma ambulante y lleva en este emprendimiento más de dos años.

Mariela formó una banca de personas debido a la necesidad que tiene su familia de conseguir un préstamo para continuar con su negocio. Ella es la presidenta de la banca de personas 'colegio Sur Group', conformado por ocho mujeres que se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales. Ella sueña con tener su restaurante propio, mientras camina por las calles vendiendo sus empanadas.
Es por esos motivos que Mariela solicita un préstamo para continuar vendiendo comida en la calle y con los beneficios ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mariela is 26 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children (in the photo she is wearing a yellow and white blouse and is sitting in the center). 

The eldest child is in elementary school, while the youngest accompanies her while she performs her daily tasks. Mariela is of dark complexion, curly hair and big hands. Her business is selling food on the street, an endeavor she has carried out for over two years. 

Mariela formed a savings group due to the need for her family to get a loan to start her business. She is the president of the Colegio Sur Group, comprised of 8 women who dedicate themselves to different commercial activities. 

While walking the streets selling her empanadas, she dreams of owning a restaurant.

It is for these reasons that Mariela is requesting a loan: to continue selling food on the street and with the income help her children.

loans.use: to continue selling food on the street and with the income help her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman who describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells hardware products. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more hardware products. Her business goal is to open two more branches within five years.

loans.use: to buy more hardware products

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Editha's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish-vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Editha is taking out a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Editha has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start over in a new home. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and married with three children, all in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsa's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Elsa has restarted her food-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elsa has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elsa is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr: La cliente Rose est une vaillante commerçante depuis 15 ans, conseillère et membre de la banque communautaire «Shalom», senior entrepreneur dynamique,  âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, qui tous  étudient.  Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 650 poissons. Son conjoint est un technicien ferrailleur. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une belle maison pour sa famille, scolariser et  nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancable.
texts.en:
Hekima client Rose has been a courageous businesswoman for 15 years, officer and member of the community group called "Shalom". A senior entrepreneur, she is 50 years of age, married, and the mother of nine children who are all in school. She sells salted fish. She displays her merchandise at the central market of the town. 

Rose is asking for a  loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to buy 650 fish. Her spouse is a technician and scrap metal dealer. She began her business with money received from her husband. In future she would like to build a nice house for her family and feed and pay school fees for her children. She thanks Hekima for the support it gives to women entrepreneurs who can't obtain a bank loan.

loans.use: to buy 650 fish

loans.name: Lucia Graciela

texts.es: Lucia tiene 56 años de edad, ella es una señora colombiana que comenta que se vino de su país natal hacia Ecuador desde hace 30 años  en busca de trabajo y una vida tranquila ya que en Colombia el trabajo es muy escaso y además existen muchos enfrentamientos, Lucia agradece a Fodemi por apoyarle en su negocio ya que otras instituciones le niegan crédito a las personas colombianas, Lucia vive en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y de este negocio espera mejorar sus ingresos y quedarse viviendo en Ecuador y de ser posible comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 56, is a Colombian woman.  She says that she came from her native country to Ecuador 30 years ago looking for work and a peaceful life.  In Colombia work is very scarce, and there is a lot of fighting.

Lucia is grateful to FODEMI for supporting her in her business.  Other institutions deny loans to Colombians.

Lucia lives in the country, and she raises animals and works in agriculture.  She is married and has three grown children.
She will use the loan to buy pigs.  From this business she hopes to improve her sales and stay living in Ecuador and make it possible to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua is married with three children, all in school and still under her care. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Maua has operated a business selling clothes at the market to town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Maua dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 46 years old and single with one child who is 17 years old. She has been livestock and crop farming for the last 20 years. This business is able to provide her with an income of about KES 10,000 every month.

She has applied for her first loan after joining VisionFund Kenya. Serah plans to use the money to expand her farming activities by planting different varieties of crops and also to buy fertilizer for the crops. 

In the future, she would like to have a good business and educate her child and get employed.

loans.use: To expand her farming activities and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Hawa. She is married and has three children aged 26, 23, 13 and five years. In 1997 Hawa established her provision business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of the family and to educate her children. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy drinks, milk and sugar for resale. In the future Hawa plans to develop her business by having a second shop. High competition and low capital are major challenges she is facing. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will accomplish her dream by opening another outlet. Thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Clara Agripina

texts.es:
Clara tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Clara  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, además a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra lo necesario para las siembras, además comprar pollos, cerdos y alimento de crianza y engorde.

El sueño es contar con salud y dinero. El desafío al que se enfrenta las plagas y la competencia.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a descansar y pasearse con la familia.
texts.en:
Clara is 41 years old, is in a civil union and has three children. She lives in the administrative region of Ventanas Provincia de los Rios. 

Her region is located within the precincts of San Francisco and is a part of the San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish. She works in agriculture. 

Clara makes a living growing corn, soy beans, and raising chickens and pigs. She is asking for this loan so she can purchase all the necessary supplies to grow more soy beans and corn, as well as purchase more livestock like chickens, pigs and feed. 

Her dream is to be in good health and to have some money. Her biggest challenges are the agricultural plagues and the competition with other growers.

In her free time, she likes to rest and spend time with her family.

loans.use: purchase supplies to grow soy beans and corn.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Memunatu.  She is married, and has two children aged 12 and 6 years. In 2008, Memunatu established her  grocery shop selling Peak milk, sugar, sardines, and lunch meat, etc. She began her business because she wanted  a  better standard of living and to improve her earnings. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 890,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more sardines, Peak milk, sugarcane, and lunchmeat for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit and enhance her   standard of living.   In the future, Memunatu plans to educate her two children up to university and buy a plot of land to construct a dwelling house. The cost of provisions is very expensive so this type of business requires a huge sum of money. Also, huge tax rates  are  a challenge she is facing.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, Peak milk, sugarcane, and lunch meat for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 47 años de edad la cual se desempeña como madre de 2 hijos.
En vista de que los ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar no eran suficientes, comenzó con una actividad a la cual le dedica mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, esta actividad es la cría de pollos, con los que ha podido mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia.
Como persona cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos, por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio; es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde, alimento para los mismos y en materiales para la adecuación de su galpón el cual tiene ubicado a un lado de su casa.
Con estos elementos podrá mejorar sus ventas teniendo más produccion en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más pollos que ofertar.
Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por ellos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and a mother of two children.

Seeing as her household income was not enough to cover all household costs, Gloria started a new business where she puts in a lot of time and effort. This business is raising chickens and, through it, she has been able to improve her family's living conditions.

As head of the family, Gloria is responsible for covering all household costs and so does not have much capital to invest in her business. As a result she needs a loan in order to buy chickens to fatten up, and chicken feed. Gloria will also use this loan in order to buy materials to fix the shed that she has to one side of her house.

With these items Gloria will be able to increase sales, with greater production at her microbusiness. The business will also seem more attractive to customers as there will be more chickens on offer.

Gloria's main dream is to be able to earn a good income so that her family does not need for anything. Gloria herself has lacked things in life, and this affected her greatly. She therefore works constantly for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed, and to fix her shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rakhi

texts.en:
Rakhi is from Maynaguri. She is a rural woman of 39 years old. Her family consists of her husband, Kishor, and only one son, who is a student of grade seven. Rakhi and her husband both studied until ninth grade. They live in a remote region, Khagrabari, in Jalpaiguri district.

Rakhi is a homemaker. Her husband is the sole provider for the family and works hard to meet the household expenses and the educational expenses of their son. He deals in spices. He purchases spices (cumin, cinnamon, coriander, cardamom, etc.) from wholesale sellers in bulk quantities and supplies the grocery stores and also the local people of his locality. 

Rakhi also assists her husband in his business.He has goodwill for his quality and behavior in his locality. He established his business many years ago and since then, he has been providing for his family through his business. He has good experience in this business, and is well known in the neighborhood. He needs to increase his selling goods inventory to satisfy his customers’ demands, as well as to have additional income to strengthen the family economy.

So, Rakhi has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner), which gives business loans to rural needy women. She plans to purchase more spices. She is aiming to grow the business to satisfy their customers and increase the profit so that she can give better living conditions to her child with good food, health and education.

Her full thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for their existing spice business.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DIVINA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de refrescos y gaseosas, artesanía en quenas y zampoñas, venta de comida, artesanía en tejido de mantas y chompas, artesanía en material reciclable, venta de calzados.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dionicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que tenía el mismo negocio, cuando se casó decide emprender un negocio independiente, ya que tenía experiencia en el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias aledañas a su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
“Luz Divina” (Divine Light) is a Communal Bank that will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. It is composed of eight members, guided by a directive board presided over by Dionicia. The member of the Communal Bank engage in different activities such as selling soft drinks and sodas, making Andean flutes and Pan pipes, selling meals, weaving blankets and jumpers, making handicrafts with recycled materials, selling shoes.

Dionicia is one of the micro entrepreneurs of this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. She says that she has become a member of Pro Mujer for the first time, having joined the institution following their intense promotion campaign. She is currently selling meals, and she says she learned her job from her father who used to run the same activity. After she got married, she decided starting working independently in this field, as she could count on some experience.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her supplies for the dry season by buying food at wholesale price from wholesalers in the town of El Alto; she will then prepare her meals and sell them during the various fairs that take place in her neighborhood. This type of activity helps her earning an income to economically support her family, as she is married and has a son.

When asked about what she likes of Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the life insurance provided by the institution.

loans.use: Compra de víveres por mayor

loans.name: Shirinmo

texts.ru:
Ширинмо живет и работает на районе Дж.Руми. Ей 43 года. С ней проживает ее 21 летняя дочь. Муж Ширинмо скончался, и она с дочерью живет одна. Ширинмо предоставляет услугу швеи. И свой опыт и умение она передала свой дочери, которая в свою очередь тоже предоставляет услугу портнихи. 
   Причина, по которой Ширинмо обратилась за кредитом, является покупка кондиционера. Летом в Таджикистане очень жарко и днем на улице ходить невозможно, а в домах душно. Ширинмо давно хочет купить кондиционер, но достаточной суммы не смогла собрать. В этом году летом гораздо жарче, чем обычно и у Ширинмо с дочерью больше не остается выбора, кроме того что обратиться за кредитом и приобрести кондиционер. Ширинмо будет оплачивать кредит за счет деятельности своей и дочери.
texts.en:
Shirinmo lives and works in the J.Rumy district. She is 43 years old. Her 21-year-old daughter lives with her. Shirinmo's husband passed away, and she and her daughter live alone. Shirinmo provides sewing services. She shared her experience and skill with her daughter, who also provides the same services. 

The reason for Shirinmo's request for a loan is a purchase of an air conditioner. Summers in Tajikistan are very hot, making it impossible to be outside and too stuffy to be inside. Shirinmo has been wanting to buy an air conditioner for a long time, but could not save enough money. This year, the summer is much hotter than usual, and Shirinmo and her daughter no longer have a choice, besides requesting a loan and purchasing the air conditioner. Shirinmo will use her and her daughter's business income to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she rears rabbits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more rabbits. She hopes that in the future, she will have a rabbit farm. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 23-year-old single lady. She runs a mobile money transfer business as well as selling mobile phone accessories in her shop. She has been in this business for the last two and a half years and she is able to make a monthly profit of Kenya shillings 26,200.

She has applied for her second loan and she plans to use this amount to add to her inventory of the mobile phone accessories as well as add more business float for the money transfer business. She hopes to make more profit which she plans to use to open another similar shop in another area and thus expand her business.

loans.use: To add stock of phone accessories as well as float for her mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be generous. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, washing soap, rice and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

Felister describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread, washing soap and other items she sells. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah is a married man who has four children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells lumber. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor transport. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more lumber. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a better business person. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance bank.

loans.use: to buy more lumber

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 44 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. Emily has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Emily has taken a 9,800 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Emily is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz, 60, is a married woman with eight children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emperatriz's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Emperatriz has restarted her tailoring business and is committed to regain what she lost. Emperatriz is taking out a PHP 9,866 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Emperatriz has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to restart her life in a new home. In the future, Emperatriz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 49 years old and married with two children, both in school. Estela works very hard to provide for her family.

Estela's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Estela has restarted her recycled materials business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Estela has taken out a PHP 9,900 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Estela is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sardines, powdered milk, sugarcane, and lunch meat for resale.

loans.name: Paul B

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Paul who is married and has three children, ages 17,14, and 4. In 2011, Paul established his Internet café business. He began his business because his wife saw the need for such a service in their area. Also, she is computer literate. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 600,000  every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Paul requires a loan to buy a photocopier for his café. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit margin. In the future, Paul plans to improve his business and his family status. Presently, he lacks equipment like a photocopier and generator to run the business. He thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for his café.

loans.name: Faith Joy

texts.en:
Faith Joy is 32 years old, married and has one child who is in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were destroyed

A NWTF borrower since 2010, Faith Joy has requested a housing loan for PHP 5800 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Faith Joy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Amara .g

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Amara G.  He is married and has one child aged 6 years. In 2009, Amara G established his pharmacy business. He began this business because he wanted to improve his  standard of living.  Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 805,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. 

Amara G requires a loan in order to purchase more medicines. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by enhancing his earnings and profit margins. In the future, Amara plans to improve his business and his family status. Competition and low capital are the major challenges he is facing. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sardines, Peak milk, sugarcane, and lunch meat for resale.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Munguiko est une brave commerçante et membre d’un groupe  d’affaires «Baraka Alanine», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 32ans, mariée  et mère de 9 enfants, 8 sont scolarisés et 1 encore petit. La cliente est une vendeuse d’arachides. Elle étale sa marchandise  dans un marché  de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint est un cambiste (Changeur de monnaies). Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 sacs d’arachides. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Hekima client Munguiko is a good businesswoman and member of a group called «Baraka Alanine». She is a senior entrepreneur, aged 32, married and the mother of nine children, eight enrolled in school and one still too young for school. She sells peanuts, displaying her merchandise in a town market. She began her business with money loaned her by Hekima. Her husband is a currency changer. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

The new loan will allow her to buy 10 sacks of peanuts. In this way, she hopes to grow her working capital, and feed, clothe and pay school fees for her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima sincerely for helping women entrepreneurs who can't obtain bank loans to become independent, especially in this critical post-conflict period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married and has two children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more scratch cards to sell.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 19-year-young housewife from the remote village, Magurmari, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Together with her husband, she is raising her only daughter, who is too small to go to school. She is married to Sukanta.  Arati received education up to grade seven.   

Arati's husband runs a small grocery shop in their locality. It is the only source of income for the family. He purchases varieties of grocery items and products for daily use from the wholesale market and sells them in his locality and door to door to neighbors. His earnings were not sufficient for the household expenses yet.  They have to face many problems due to the increased prices of essential commodities. 

Arati has decided to help her husband.  She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to expand the business. With the loan, she wants to purchase more grocery items such as rice, oil, biscuits, lentils, flour, soft drinks, etc. to expand her grocery stock and to meet her customers’ demand. She hopes she can gain more profit from this business. It will definitely sustain her family's daily needs so that poverty cannot affect her kid. 

In the future, she dreams to buy a cycle-van or an auto-rickshaw with the profit from her business to sustain her transport costs.

She thanks her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her existing grocery shop.

loans.name: Babli

texts.en:
Babli, 29 years old and the mother of one child, is from Dhupguri. She is married to Kajal, who is a cultivator by profession. They live at Baroghoria, a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri. Babli has completed her Bachelors level of education, while her husband attended school up to grade 12. She is a housewife who looks after her husband and her young child and manages the household. After that, she helps her husband in his work.

Babli's husband has their own plot of land where he has been mainly farming vegetables such as potatoes, beans, eggplants, gourds, etc. He has been in this agricultural activity for the last few years. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream to expand his business and secure the future of the family. With the increasing expenses of his family, he needs to increase his income by cultivating some other crop. They have chosen paddy to cultivate, as it is the staple food for not only the people of their region, but also for the people throughout West Bengal. So, they hope it will be a lucrative business.


Babli is energetic, enthusiastic and determined to make a future through hard work and cooperation. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase necessary supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so that they can start the cultivation as early as possible. She hopes the loan will help her to raise her standard of living and to purchase more agricultural land to expand their agribusiness.

She is thankful to the generous investors (BJS and Kiva) who stand for her.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
O Sr: Mateus de 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4  filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a  escola no ensino primario e os 2 sao menores de idade e nao frequentam a escola. Ele è operario agricola na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 4 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, chapas de zinco e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Mateus is 33 years old, married and the father of 4 children, 2 of whom go to primary school and 2 who are too small to go to school. He has worked in agriculture at the local banana growing company for the last 4 years.

With this loan he will buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sheets of zinc and payment for labour) to continue building his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sheets of zinc and payment for labour) to continue building his house.

loans.name: Kezi

texts.en: Kezi is married with four children, three in school. She has a business selling and frying chapati (East African bread) and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, charcoal and baking flour. She works in a shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and transportation. She is aspiring to own a big bakery and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, charcoal and baking flour.

loans.name: Romao

texts.pt:
O Sr. Romao de 27 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele è operador de maquina na empresa  de producao de banana a mais de  4 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera  aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a sua obra.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia para vender produtos diversos.
Diz que ira pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais créditos.
texts.en:
Mr Romao is 27 years old and the father of 2 children who are both in primary school. He has worked on the machines at the banana growing company for the last 4 years.

With this loan he will buy construction materials (cement, sheets of zinc, beams and payment of labour) to continue building his house.

In future he hopes to build a grocery store to sell various products.

He says he will pay on time and ask for further loans.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sheets of zinc, beams and payment of labour) to continue building his house

loans.name: Aries Group

texts.en:
Nengkhochin (22) is the featured member of the group, Aries Lom, and is shown with a raised hand. She originally lived in Tamenglong District of Manipur. Due to financial problems in the family, she had to move in with her uncle’s family in Churachandpur district. Her uncle lives with his wife and a school-going daughter striving to lead a better life. She helps her uncle in running their shop, which she wanted to upgrade by taking a loan and using it for purchasing varieties of items for the shop. 

Her monthly income is 5,200 INR, and the household monthly income is 39,000 INR. She wanted to save money for her future and for her marriage by running the shop with her uncle because her parents are in no position to take care of the financial matters for her send-off ceremony and wedding.

The group, Aries Lom, was formed by members with similar interests and who share a similar economic background, to get a loan that will develop their economic activities. The other members are engaged in weaving different types of traditional shawls and wrap-arounds, namely Thangnang, Saipikhup, Senior Jem, Lengte Jem, and Ninel Jem.

loans.use: to buy items such as detergent powder, candles, match boxes, vegetable oil, sugar, salt, dal, biscuits, kangla eatables, soap, etc. for her shop, and also to purchase yarn for weaving different types of traditional shawls and wrap-arounds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Leida Florentina

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Leída, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Leída junto al esposo  para salir adelante tienen una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas, artículos de bazar y papelería, gas de uso domestico lo cual les deja muy buenos ingresos, trabajan todo el día desde la madrugada y muy entrada la noche. Tienen más de 8 años que se dedican a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, gas, aguas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo meets every two weeks in the  Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana parish, a place of honest people dedicated to working in the fields and raising animals. It is a place of beautiful country landscapes and friendly people. Senora Leida lives in this place. She is 57 years old, is married and from this union she and  her husband have five independent, grown children. 

Her husband is a merchant. With her husband, Doña Leída  has been getting ahead. They have a general store and sell all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables, greens, fruits, nicknacks, paper goods, and gas for household uses. The store brings them a good income. They work from early morning until late at night. For more than eight years, they have been engaged in this activity that has enabled them to get ahead. 

Senora Leida is going to use this loan to add to the supplies in her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, gas, and  water, among other basic necessities. She has been in the Grupo de Credito since its inception and she likes it because the loans have helped them a lot. Her goals are to continue to grow her store a little every day.

loans.use: to buy food products and household necessities for sale

loans.name: Famosas De Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FAMOSAS DE PRIMAVERA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de maíz tostado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace seis años al observar que este negocio no existía en su zona y decidió solicitar ayuda a económica a su familia. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank group "FAMOSAS de PRIMAVERA" launches their third cycle in ProMujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center. The group consists of eight members headed by a board of which Máxima is president. Businesses that the members carry forth are varied and include a grocery store, a neighborhood store, selling clothes, sewing clothing, and selling roasted corn.

The requested loan is a great benefit for small microentrepreneurs like Máxima. She began working with ProMujer a year ago, entering on the invitation of a promoter of the institution. Today she has a neighborhood store businesses. She began this business six years ago because it did not exist in the area. She decided to pursue it to help her family economically. 

The loan will bring an increase of capital for wholesale grocery shopping. She will buy wholesale in the city of El Alto to subsequently sell in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as she lives in a domestic partnership and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she says that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock for her neighborhood grocery store

loans.name: Mariuxy Cesibel

texts.es:
Mariuxi es una señora casada, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas, una niña asiste a la escuela fiscal del sector y la otra es aún una nena de un añito, juntos viven en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, sector de la costa del Ecuador, conocida por ser el puerto terrestre del país ya que es aquí donde se une la sierra y la costa.
Mariuxi es una señora muy dedicada a sus hijas y a su trabajo, ella recorre a vender sábanas, edredones, toallas y ropa, cuenta con clientela fija, con este ingreso ella ha podido aportar en su familia, por las tardes ya está junto a sus hijas en el cuidado de ellas. Su esposo también ayuda mucho, él trabaja de constructor ya varios años.
Mariuxi con este crédito podrá comprar más mercadería, invertir en toldos, almohadas y más ropa, para surtir su negocio, con esto aspira mejorar sus ingresos y luego poco a poco en un futuro no muy lejano desea ponerse un local
Se siente muy agradecida con Fundación Alternativa y todas las personas que conforman Kiva por hacer posible poder recibir un crédito a que ninguna otra institución le había abierto las puertas.
texts.en:
Mariuxi is married, she lives with her husband and two daughters. One of the girls goes to the public school in the area, and the other one is still a one-year-old baby.  The live together in her parent's home in the city of Santo Domingo De Los Tsachilas, a sector of the coast of Ecuador known to be the terrestrial port of the country, since it is where the mountain range and the coast meet.

Mariuxi is very dedicated to her daughters and to her work. She goes around selling bed sheets, quilts, towels, and clothing. She has loyal customers, and she has been able to contribute to her family with this income. By the afternoon she is already back to the care of her daughters. Her husband also helps a lot, he has been working in construction for several years now.

With this loan, Mariuxi will be able to buy more merchandise, invest in awnings, pillows, and more garments, to stock her business. With this she aspires to increase her income, and then, little by little, in a not too distant future, she wants to set up a shop. She is very thankful to Fundacion Alternativa, and to all the people at Kiva, for making it possible for her to receive a loan, for which no other institution had opened doors for her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as awnings, pillows, and more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to organize a wedding in according with her country's cultural traditions.

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en: Nijat is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a tiny village. People here work in agriculture and commerce, and also raise livestock. Nijat earns a living by making furniture, and has many customers who live nearby. He has requested a loan from VFAC for 1,000 AZN to build a fence in his yard to make his home more secure. This loan will help him avoid having to borrow money from friends or relatives, which can lead to stress and tension. Nijat is very grateful for the opportunity to request this loan, and wants to thank all of his lenders.

loans.use: to build a fence in his yard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, stone and payment of labour) to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her health.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open business and have a stable income.

loans.name: Dragón De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DRAGON DE ORO” iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de edredones, costura de chamarras, costura de gorras, venta de poleras, venta de ropa interior, venta de medias, venta de chompas, costura de pantalones y costura de overoles y chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de edredones; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga a quien le observó en su negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de coser) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente instalará en su taller de costura. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se puede observar que una de las clientes no esta presente, ella se encuentra en el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The "Dragon de Oro" (Golden Dragon) lending group is entering it's 25th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group is comprised of 10 members, and it is led by a board of directors of which Sandra is the treasurer.  The members of the communal bank are involved in a variety of businesses that include: selling quilts, sewing jackets, sewing hats, selling shirts, selling underwear, selling socks, selling sweaters, sewing pants, sewing coveralls and sewing jackets.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit the small businesses of the group in which Sandra is a member.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling quilts.  She states that she started this business five years ago when she learned the trade by observing her friend in her business.

The loan that she is now requesting will be used to increase her capital by purchasing a sewing machine.  She will purchase the machine from one of the wholesalers in the city of El Alto.  She will then install it in her workshop.  This form of work allows her to earn an income to support her family since she lives with her partner and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the training offered by the institution.  One of the members is not shown in the picture because she was at the doctor's office.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open an animal-husbandry business.

loans.name: Cubanitas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUBANITAS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salteñas, venta de ropa interior, venta de api, venta de pescado, venta de comida, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beatriz es integrante, ella indica que hace siete ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior donde trabajaba de operaria, posteriormente con un poco de capital decide implementar un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.

Una de las socias esta ausente en la imagen, por razones personales no deseaba salir en la imagen del grupo.
texts.en:
The group “CUBANITAS DE VILLA INGENIO” will start its 7th cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Andes Focus Centre.  It is formed by 9 members and directed by a board where Beatriz is the President.  The businesses that these members have are varied, amongst them are: “salteñas” (Bolivian pastry) sales, underwear sales, “api” (Bolivian beverage made from corn) sales, fish sales, food sales, and dressmaking.

The loan requested will benefit small entrepreneurs where Beatriz is a member.  She mentions that she has been with Pro Mujer for 7 cycles.  She joined through a friend’s invitation who is a client of the institution.  Currently she has a dressmaking shop, she indicates that she learned this business from a previous job, later on with some capital she started her independent business.

The loan requested is to increase working capital (to buy fabric at wholesale) that she will buy from the wholesalers of the city El Alto.  She will then make and sell clothing as per her clients’ requests.  This way she can generate resources to support her family, she lives with her common-law partner and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she indicates it’s the training that the institution provides.

One of the members chose not to be in the picture due to personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Henie

texts.en: Henie is 49 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and home were wiped out. She is requesting a loan for PHP 9,066 to buy building materials and pay for labor to build a new house for her family. Henie has been a NWTF borrower since 2012, and plans to rebuild her general store. With your help, she can rebuild her house, rebound from the devastation of the typhoon and save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Fatmata, who is single and without children. In 2012, she established a business selling rice, oil, couscous, milk, Ovaltine and sardines. Fatmata began her business because after her exams she did not have fees to continue studying. She works seven days a week, 12 hours a day and earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month. Fatmata’s major business challenges are competition and the rainy season. 

Fatmata is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to purchase bags of rice, tomato, couscous, milk, and mayonnaise to sell. She hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. Fatmata states that “in the future I want to further my education and still continue with the business.”

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, tomato, couscous, milk, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of basins, lamps and other items

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 37 years old and is married with two children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Jasmin has been a borrower with NWTF since 2011. 

Jasmin is requesting a 7,980 PHP loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She plans to recover from the typhoon through her food vending business. With your help, Jasmin can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mulangane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luseka est une commerçante et membre  d’un groupe  d’affaires «Mulangane», entrepreneur, âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, dont 4 scolarisés et 2 sont grands. La cliente est une vendeuse de maïs en graine. Elle étale sa marchandise à domicile où elle a érigé un dépôt dans un quartier de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec  de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint est un agent dans une maison de gardiennage. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
