Luseka is a merchant and member of the business group Mulangane. A 47-year-old entrepreneur, she is married with six children; four of them are in school and two are grown up. Her husband is a security guard.   

Luseka sells maize. She conducts her sales from her home; she runs a depot in a local district. She has been engaged in this activity for 2 years, and she initially started with funding from Hekima.  

Luseka plans to use this loan to buy 3 sacks of maize. Her goals are to bolster her capital, buy a house, and ensure that her children are fed, clothed, and educated. 

Luseka wishes to thank Hekima for helping women entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system in their efforts to become self-sufficient, especially in these difficult post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Isatu. She is married and has three children, ages one, five, and 13. In 2009, Isatu established a business selling baby clothing and supplies. She began her business to assist her husband in the running of their home. Isatu works seven days a week, nine hours a day, and she earns about 1,100,000 SLL each month. Her major business challenges are competition and low funds. 

Isatu is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to buy baby clothing and supplies to resell. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Isatu is looking forward to the funds that will help her to develop her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing and supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 33-year-old lady who is married to Samuel. The couple is blessed with two children, ages five and seven. For the last five years, Margaret has sold food and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Margaret is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as vegetables and fruits to have enough products to sell to customers. She will use the profit from her loan to expand her business and repay her loan. Margaret hopes to have a great future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. For the past five years, she has operated a kiosk where she sells goods to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanaidi owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mwanaidi is requesting a loan to purchase biscuits, wheat flour, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, wheat flour, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria se sigue dedicando al negocio de confeccion y venta de textiles como tejidos y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos como chullos,mantas y chalinas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lana de diferentes colores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Victoria, continues to make a living from the confectionary business and selling textiles, such as fabric weaving. The partner sells different garments like chullos (Andean style hat with earflaps), blankets, and shawls. She works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM. She has spent 8 years in this business and she is doing very well. Her dream is to expand the business of selling fabrics and weavings. This member is requesting a loan to purchase wool of different colors. 

The member is happy for the loan and she agrees to meet her quota payments.

loans.use: the member is requesting a loan to purchase wool of different colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a Babban Gona farmer from Kwankwani. Yohanna expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Yohanna to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yohanna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yohanna is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Yohanna will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Yohanna will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Elkin

texts.es: Elkin de 33 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 12 años en un municipio área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Desde hace 3 años cuando quedó desempleado, tomó su liquidación y compró implementos para iniciar su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, aprovechando que contaba con una basta experiencia en esta actividad. Su mayor esfuerzo inició impulsado por sacar adelante a sus hijos que son el motivo de su inspiración para continuar poniendo todos sus esfuerzos productivos en este propósito. Hoy ofrece salchipapas, es decir una mezcla de salchichas, papas fritas y salsas, además de perros calientes, chuzos, carne asada etc. Su día laboral inicia desde la 5 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde y posteriormente desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche, atendiendo en su punto de ventas. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa, pero tiene el gran desafío de no contar con un capital que invierta y le permita generara mas ingresos. Esta es justamente a razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materia prima como carne de res cerdo, pollo salsas en un mayor volumen. Con su inversión planea aumentar su productividad y lograr la atracción de muchos más clientes, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Elkin, a 33-year-old, lives with his spouse and two children, aged 7 and 12 years, in a municipality within the Barranquilla metropolitan area. Three years ago he was laid off, and so he took his severance and bought tools to start a business selling fast food, drawing on his vast experience in this area. 

His great effort was driven by his desire to properly raise his children, who are the inspiration in his continuing efforts.

Nowadays, he offers salchipapas, i.e. a mixture of sausage, chips and sauces, as well as hot dogs, skewered meat, carne asada, etc. His working day spans from 5 am to 1 pm and then from 5 pm to midnight tending the point of sales. 

His goal down the line is to have his own house, but he faces the current challenge of not having sufficient capital to invest and thereby generate more income. 

This is precisely the reason why he turns to credikiva, the first loan administered by the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will purchase raw materials like pork, chicken and sauces in a greater volume. With this investment, he plans to increase his productivity and achieve greater customer interest, making his credikiva a successful investment.

loans.use: buy raw materials  in bulk like beef, pork, chicken and sauces.

loans.name: Joséphine's Group

texts.fr: Joséphine est commerçante et membre d’un collectif  d’affaires «La Joie », entrepreneur, âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 5 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise  à domicile sur la rue du quartier animé de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec le fonds reçu son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sac de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif,  elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des  femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Joséphine is a merchant and member of the business group La Joie. A 34-year-old entrepreneur, she is married with six children; five of them are in school and one is still a toddler. Her husband is a merchant as well.   

Joséphine sells foodstuffs. She conducts her sales from her home on the street of a busy district. She has been engaged in this activity for 12 years, and she initially started with capital given to her by her husband. She later obtained funding from Hekima.    

Joséphine plans to use this loan to buy one sack of potatoes. Her goals are to ensure that her children are fed, clothed, and educated. 

Joséphine wishes to thank Hekima for helping women entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system in their efforts to become self-sufficient, especially in these difficult post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy one sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Justus, a very humble, honest and hard-working man who is 30 years of age. Justus has a keen eye on farming and he does it with passion so that he can take care of his two children and be able to give them a secure future. Justus is a very dedicated farmer who has been doing farming for the past 4 years and has managed to always be on top of his game. Justus enjoys dairy farming so much and the best part is when he is milking his cow in the evening you will hear Justus singing joyfully as he milks his cow. Through enjoying what he does Justus has even nicknamed his cow "mrembo" which means beautiful. Through the cow he has been making a lot of profits through milk selling.

Justus is seeking a loan of KES 52,000 to buy a dairy cow and be able to fully utilize the space and grazing land in his compound. Through increased milk production Justus is sure of comfortably taking care of his family and being able to kick out the poverty levels that he is currently facing.

Justus plans to open a big dairy shop and a cooling plant where farmers can store their milk before processing but all this dreams can become a reality if he gets the loan that he is requesting.

Through profits from the business Justus is sure that his family will never lack anything and his children's futures will be secured.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Savina

texts.es:
La socia Savina  se sigue dedicando negocio de agricultura y crianza de animales, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Savina continues with her business of agriculture and raising animals. She has farmland where she cultivates cacao and coffee. She works from 6:00am until 5:00pm. She has been in this business for several years now and she is doing very well. Her dream is to enlarge her plot of land.

She requests the loan to buy seed and fertilizers. She is happy with the loan, and she promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Central Alpacoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL ALPACOMA” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gricela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, confección de chompas, venta de carne, venta de queso, servicio de cafetería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gricela es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  taller de confección de ropa de varón; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su pareja, comenta que cuando lo conoció él ya tenía un taller de costura por eso le fue enseñando poco a poco la técnica de costura. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará sus productos en espacio de comercialización. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no esta presente una de las cliente, la misma se fue por razones personales.
texts.en:
The communal association, “CETNRAL ALPACOMA”, will begin the fifth cycle of Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Villa Exaltación. The association is made up of 8 members, and a directive table manages it where Mrs. Gricela is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry forward vary, among them exist: selling clothes, making sweaters, selling meat, selling cheese, cafeteria services. 

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs of which Mrs. Gricela is a member. She states that it has been 2 years since she has been a member of Pro Mujer, joining in at the invitation of a friend that is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business in a workshop making clothes for men. She indicates that she opened this business alongside her partner. When she met her partner, he already had a sewing workshop and that is why he taught her, slowly, sewing techniques. 

The loan she is requesting now is to increment her capital (to purchase wholesale fabrics) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers of the city of El Alto. After she makes the clothes, she will sell her products in a marketing space. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health area and the training offered by the institution. 

In the photograph one of the members is absent; she left for personal reasons.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale fabric

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Leatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Apholos, Simon, and  Isuwa. Leatu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Leatu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Leatu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Leatu is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Sarah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Bathelemew, Nicodemus, and  Peacemaker. Sarah is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Sarah will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Sarah can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Sarah is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jesus Te Ama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JESUS TE AMA” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de accesorios de autos, costura de chamarras, venta de condimentos, venta de masitas, servicio de internet, costura de deportivos, costura de overoles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años conjuntamente sus familiares, ya que ellos trabajaban realizando este arte. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fibra de vicuña por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones que se desarrollan con sus compañeras de Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
The lending group, "Jesus Te Ama" (Jesus Loves You) is entering its 22nd cycle in Pro Mujer as part of their German Busch regional office.  The group is made up of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors of which Francisca is the president.  The members of the lending group are involved in a variety of businesses including: selling meats, selling car accessories, sewing jackets, selling condiments, selling pastries, offering internet service, sewing sports equipment, sewing coveralls.  

The loan that they are seeking will benefit the small businesses in the group.  Francisca states that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by her neighbor who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a business weaving blankets from Vicuña.  She tells us that she started this business many years ago with her family since they work making these crafts.

The loan will help her to increase her capital by purchasing Vicuña fibers in bulk from the traditional markets in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell the blankets that she weaves in her store.  This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family since she is married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the meetings that she has with her members.

loans.use: purchase Vicuña fibers in bulk.

loans.name: Celia Soledad

texts.es: Celia tiene 46 años de edad  y habita en casa propia, sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya viven aparte con su propias familias. Celia se gana  la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir, sandalias y lociones. Tiene 14 años de recorrer las principales zonas de su localidad con el fin de ofrecer y vender sus productos. Celia desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve sus pocas pertenencias se mojan. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y pines para reparar el techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Celia is 46 years old and lives in a house that she owns.  Her children are adults and live on their own with their own families.  Celia earns a living by selling a variety of apparel, sandals and lotions.  She has 14 years of experience traveling throughout the main areas of her town to offer and sell her products.  

Celia wishes to repair the roof of her home because it is currently in poor shape.  When it rains, her few belongings get wet.  For this, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase sheet metal, wood and headers to repair the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal, woods and headers to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: La Bendición Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LA BENDICIÓN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de batidos, tienda de abarrotes, venta de fruta, taller de tapicería de sillones, venta de faldas, venta de pescados, venta de jugos, venta de café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años conjuntamente sus familiares, ya que ellos negocian con los mismos productos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que se ofrece en la institución.
texts.en:
The "La Bendición" communal bank is entering its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of their German Busch regional office.  The group is made up of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors of which Lidia is the president.  The members of the group are involved in a variety of businesses including: selling smoothies, grocery stores, selling fruit, chair upholstery workshops, selling skirts, selling fish, selling juices, selling coffee.

The loan that they are seeking will benefit small businesses of which Lidia is a member.  Lidia joined Pro Mujer three years ago when she was invited by a neighbor who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling fruit.  She started this business many years ago with her family since they also sell the same products.  

The loan will be used to increase her capital by purchasing fruit in bulk from the markets in the city of El Alto.  She will then sell it in her store.  This line of work allows her to earn an income to support her family since she lives in a common-law marriage and has one son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Gracias al primer préstamo que recibió pudo comprar una máquina para hacer pantalones, además de ello pudo abrir un pequeño negocio; antes del primer crédito tenía mucho desconocimiento de cómo adquirir apoyo de los bancos o instituciones como ADICLA y KIVA. Gracias al préstamo ha mejorado su negocio y también han mejorado sus ingresos. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de otra máquina ya que la que tiene no es suficiente por la demanda de pantalones que existe.  Su sueño más importante es que su negocios crezca y tener varias maquinas y asi sus ingresos sean más grandes
texts.en: Thanks to the first loan he received, Francisco was able to buy a sewing machine to make trousers.  He also started a small business.  Before getting the initial loan, Francisco knew little about how to get help from banks or institutions like ADICLA and KIVA.    With the help of the loan he has improved his business and also increased his income.  Francisco will invest the new loan in buying another machine since the one he has is not enough for the existing demand for trousers.  The dream that matters most to him is that his business will grow and he will have several sewing machines and thus his income will be larger.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con los padres en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

María se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de arroz, maíz, además se dedica a la cría de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas y alimento para los animales.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.
El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia y las plagas.
le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old; she is single and has a kid. She lives with her parents in the Ventanas Canton, a province of Rios. The Cevallos communal bank is located in the San Francisco neighborhood; it belongs to the San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish. The members make a living from agricultural labor. 

Maria makes a living from agriculture, she plants rice, corn, and she also raises hens. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, insecticides, and animal food. 

With the loan’s support, she will be able to purchase the necessary inputs for agriculture. She will make the purchases in Ventanas. Her challenges are competition and pests. She likes to practice sports.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Renacer De Hoy Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENCER DE HOY” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vicenta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: repostería, cotillones, venta de comida, venta de pescado, confección busos de lana, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vicenta es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años por iniciativa propia, al observar la necesidad de este servicio en su zona. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital, compra de chuño (papa seca) por mayor, que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que se ofrece en la institución.
texts.en:
The "Rencer de Hoy" communal bank is entering its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office.  The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Vicenta is the president.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses including: bakeries, party favors, food sales, fish sales, making wool clothing, neighborhood stores.  

The loan that they are seeking will benefit these small businesses.  Vicenta states that this is her first time being part of Pro Mujer, having been invited by a promoter of the organization who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a business selling food.  She started this business many years ago on her own initiative after seeing the need for this service in the region.  

The loan will help her to increase her capital by purchasing chuño (dried potatoes) in bulk from the markets in the city of El Alto.  She will later cook them and sell them in her store.  This line of work allows her to earn an income to support her family since she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase chuño in bulk.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling soft drinks and has been in this business for 3 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, oranges and mangoes for squeezing juice and sugar. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

She is aspiring of owning a deep freezer and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, boxes of mineral water, oranges and mangoes for squeezing  juice and sugar.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 50 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Chita has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Chita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma, a very energetic woman of 43 years, hails from a remote village, Khalaigram, in Dhupguri. She lives with her husband, Rahidul, and two sons. Asma is illiterate and just able to sign her name only. Her husband attended school up to grade five.

Asma's husband is engaged in cultivation of land, while Asma helps him in his work after managing her household work. Her husband works hard in his field from dawn to dusk. He mainly grows vegetables, such as potatoes, gourds, beans and other seasonal vegetables. His simple and polite behavior, as well as good-quality products, has acquired a good many customers, and he wants to satisfy them by supplying more quality products.  

Now, he wants to cultivate ladies finger (okra) on his land, as it is the best season to cultivate this crop. But due to insufficient capital, he cannot materialize his plan. That is why, to help her husband, Asma is requesting financial help.

The loan she is requesting from BJS (Kiva’s partner) is to buy farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs, so that she can continue with her new vegetable cultivation activity and enjoy a better quality of life with her husband and sons. She aspires to build a concrete house for them with the profit generated from this business.

She is very much thankful to her lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds, for cultivating ladies finger.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 38-year-old farmer who lives alone in a remote community in the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He did not have light at home before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which he was gathering when this picture was taken. That SSHS includes 3 lamps which provide daily 4 hours of light each for reading for instance and the possibility of connecting a radio, mitigating his isolation. 
Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a solar PV system installed at his house.

loans.name: 4 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “4 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el vigésimo  noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido a máquina, venta de comida, costura de busos deportivos, taller eléctrico, costura de gorras, venta de coca, repostería, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un capital que su esposo le dio, ya que observaron que les generaría dividendos y podrían educar a sus hijos sin dificultades.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “4 DE AGOSTO” group will begin its 9th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. The group consists of 12 members and is directed by an executive council where Filomena is the president. The businesses the members have are varied: machine weaving, selling food, sewing sports clothing, electronic shop, making hatts, selling chocolate, bakery, weaving blankets, neighborhood stores, selling CDs, selling clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit microbusinesses where Filomena is a member. She has been with Pro Mujer for 9 years. She joining at the invitation of a friend who visited her home. Today she has a neighborhood convenience store. She began the business with a bit of capital that her husband gave her. Now they see the income it is generating and they are able to pay for their children's education without any difficulty.

The loan will be used to increase her capital to buy supplies at wholesale that she will acquire in the El Alto city market and then resell in her space. This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Radhakrushna Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support "Bimala". She is the president of "Radhakrushna SHG" self-help group and is pictured here as the lady standing with her hand raised. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India. With her portion of the loan, Bimala will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. 

After this loan, Bimala will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Bimala is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm. 

The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickle vegetables together.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to increase her dairy farming business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 39-year-old married woman with five children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her motorcycle transportation business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Jenelyn is taking out a PHP 9866.60 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Jenelyn has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Aracely Fabiola

texts.es:
Aracely es una mujer joven de 19 años de edad casada y madre de dos bebes, su negocio es una tienda de barrio con artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar.
Su vida gira alrededor de su tienda y sus bebés; uno recién nacido y otro de tres años, a los que cuida todo el día mientras atiende su negocio. Ella necesita ampliar su trabajo mediante la compra de una conservadora para pollo/embutidos y un tanque de aceite agranel.
Aracely es una chica sencilla de tez morena y cabello obscuro, terminó la escuela secundaria y se dedicó al comercio, actualmente su negocio paga los gastos básicos de sus dos bebés y ella busca satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes para generar más ingresos para su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Aracely solicita un préstamo para la compra de una conservadora de pollo y un tanque de aceite agranel para pagar los gastos de sus bebes.
texts.en:
Aracely is a young woman, 19 years old, married, and mother of two babies. Her business is a neighborhood store carrying basic household items. Her life revolves around her store and her babies, a just-born infant, and a three-year-old. She takes care of them throughout the day, while she takes care of her store.

She needs to expand her work through the purchase of a deli display case for chicken/lunchmeats, and a bulk oil tank.

Aracely is a simple girl, with tanned skin and dark hair. She completed secondary school and she worked in commerce.  Her business currently pays the basic expenses of her two babies.

She seeks to meet the needs of her customers, in order to generate more income for her family. Therefore, Aracely is requesting a loan for the purchase of a chicken deli display case, and a bulk oil tank, in order to meet her child-rearing expenses.

loans.use: to buy a chicken deli display case, and a bulk oil tank, in order to meet her child-rearing expenses.

loans.name: Alejandro Armando

texts.es: Alejandro de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos , de los cuales dos de ellos ya trabajan pero ayudan en el hogar, el se dedica a la venta de especias, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso se dedica a la crianza pollos y a la siembra del maíz, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, Alejandro  solicita un crédito para la compra de especias por mayor como: orégano, pimienta, achote, etc. y así seguir con sus ventas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alejandro is 55 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four children, two of whom now work but help at home. He sells spices as a street vendor in different neighborhoods near his home. He also raises chickens and grows corn. With his earnings he is able to provide his family's necessities. Alejandro seeks a loan to buy spices such as oregano and pepper at wholesale and in this way continue selling in order to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spices such as oregano and pepper at wholesale.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
El socio Paulino se dedica al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,papa y trigo, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Paulino is a farmer and has land where he grows corn, potato, and wheat. He works from 6:00 AM until 5:00 PM. He has farmed for several years and it is going well for him. He dreams of expanding his farmland. Paulino seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. He is happy for the loan and promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Comunidad de san isidro de chicon-Urubamba

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling Avon business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Lolita is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her direct selling Avon business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell for her direct selling Avon business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es una persona trabajadora de 43 años de edad, Casado, tiene tres hijos varones, quienes viven en el departamento de Suchitepéquez. Su actividad principal es la venta de materiales y herramientas de construcción, lleva seis años en el negocio de ferretería, su mercado son las comunidades vecinas, actividad rentable debido a que son pocos quienes se dedican a este negocio, principió con un pequeño capital que por varios años venia ahorrando, actualmente genera una ganancia lo cual permite ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales y herramientas de trabajo e incrementar su inventario, con el propósito de diversificar su mercadería. La meta a futuro de acuerdo a las ganancias es poder ver graduados a sus hijos y que cuenten con su propio capital para poder emprender un negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel is a hardworking person of 43 years old, married, he has three sons, they live in the Suchitepéquez department.

His main job is selling construction materials and tools, he has had a hardware store for six years, his market are the neighboring communities, a profitable business as few work in this enterprise, he started with a little capital and for many years he has been saving, currently he generates a profit which allows him to help sustain his family.

He is requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 to purchase materials and tools and increase his inventory, with the aim of diversifying his market. The future goal is, based on future earnings, to see his children graduate and have their own capital to start a business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and tools.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 45-year-old woman who is married and blessed with three children aged twenty, eleven and three years. For the last two years she has sold cosmetics and beauty products from her shop. She makes approximately 8,000 KES a month.

Lydiah has applied for a 15,000 KES loan to buy additional beauty products such as lotions and hair clips. She hopes to make a good return so that she can expand her business and add more stock.

In future Lydiah would like to have a more modern shop.

loans.use: To add more stock in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized steel, wood and nails to improve the roof of his dwelling.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as very motivated.

To earn a living, she operates a retail business. Specifically, she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are locals. She explains that her biggest business challenge is a lack of sufficient capital.

She is seeking this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is 27 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past four years she has raised pigs.

Lucilyn took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through NWTF. She is now applying for a 9,000 PHP loan to buy additional feed for her pigs. She is working hard to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She explains that her greatest monthly expenses are food and household goods.

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a retail business. Specifically, she has a shop, where she sells various goods to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the requested loan proceeds, she wants to purchase goods such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, soap, beans, and cooking oil for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional items (e.g., wheat flour, maize flour, rice, soap, beans, and cooking oil)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of three children. All of her children attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (4 orphans). She and her family reside in a rented house, where the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

To support her family, she operates a food-vending business. She has been in this business for 5 years. She works at the market seven days per week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income from farming. Her major business challenges include seasonality and rising costs of transportation.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes. She aspires to generate enough profits so as to buy a plot of land and to start a large-scale farming business while also becoming a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO in order to access capital.

loans.use: To expand and improve her retail business by purchasing additional bags of sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Bertha se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y patos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes,patos y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank 'Los Amautas Pan de Azucar'. The bank is situated in the Echarate district, which belongs to La Convencion province, and the Cusco department.

The partner Bertha works in a business rearing small animals such as guinea pigs, hens and ducks. The borrower fattens and grows then, and then sells then in the different fairs and markets. The partner works from 8:00am to 6:00pm, the partner has been in this business for 4 years and it's going very well. The dream of this partner is to have a store where she can sell the animals. The partner is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, ducks and hens. 

The partner is happy with the loan and she commits to making the agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, ducks and hens.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 10 to 18 years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows maize and millet. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is thirty years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Jeralyn has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP housing loan to buy construction materials and pay for labor to build a new house for her family. Her sari-sari, or grocery shop, has been reestablished and will help the family recover their lives.

With your assistance Jeralyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. Her desire is to save enough money to continue to send her children to school and see her shop prosper.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor to build a new house

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, who is married, works hard to support her family. For the past ten years she has bought and resold cashews to help support the family.

Emily is applying for a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more cashews to sell. Her desire is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cashews to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Tushikamane 'b' Group

texts.en:
Gwamaka is an unmarried mother of three daughters, who all attend school. She is in her late thirties and lives with her kids.

For six years now, she has been supporting her family by running a grocery store, where she sells beer, soda, water and spirits. Gwamaka depends on this business to generate income for her family, so she puts all of her energy into satisfying her customers, such as by playing nice music at the store. She explains that she usually works from 2 pm until after midnight on a daily basis, which allows her to realize good profits each month.

For the sake of improving her business, Gwamaka, together with other eight members, approached Tujijenge to obtain financial support. The group members will hold each other accountable to repay their portions of the loan. This is her second loan request, which she would like to use to buy business chairs and tables, and to replace defective ones. She used the previous loan, which she successfully repaid, to buy a freezer for the business and empty crates of beers. She dreams of growing her enterprise. As a result of the prior loan, Gwamaka was able to generate an increase in her income, which she used to pay school fees, household expenses, and construction costs.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing various items (e.g., business chairs and tables).

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maximiliana se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank 'Los Amautas Pan de Azucar'. The bank is situated in the Echarate district, which belongs to La Convencion province, and the Cusco department.

The partner Maximiliana works in a grocery shop business, the partner sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. The partner works from 8:00am to 10:00pm. The borrower has been in this business for 7 years, and it's going very well. The dream of this partner is to expand her grocery store business. The borrower is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The partner is happy with the loan and she commits to making the agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old and has three children. Jessica is married and two of her children are in school.

Jessica and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jessica is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,066 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been with NWTF as a borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her recycled materials business.

With your help, Jessica can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 46-year-old, married woman with three children. One of her children is in school.

Linda works very hard to provide for her family. To do so, she runs a general store in the Philippines. Linda has been in this business for 10 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy various items that she could then sell to her customers, including shampoo and groceries. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., shampoo and groceries)

loans.name: Peres

texts.en: Peres is a married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 8 to 12 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor roads. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Nieves se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos,mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,mandarinas y platanos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank 'Los Amautas Pan de Azucar'. The bank is situated in the Echarate district, which belongs to La Convencion province, and the Cusco department.

Nieves works in a fruit vending business. The partner sells bananas, mandarins and oranges. The partner works from 6:00am to 5:00pm. The partner has been in this business for many years and the business is going very well. The dream of this partner is to increase her fruit vending business. The partner is requesting a loan to purchase oranges, mandarins and bananas.

The partner is happy with the loan and she commits to making the agreed payments.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, mandarins and bananas.

loans.name: Cris

texts.en:
Cris is 25 years old and married with one child  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Cris has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Cris would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Magaji  Ayuba

texts.en: Magaji Ayuba is a 50-year-old farmer from Tudun Doka Danbasa.  As a Babban Gona member, Magaji Ayuba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Magaji Ayuba can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Magaji Ayuba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 200 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Magaji Ayuba said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children, Mika, Shitu, and Adamu, and in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality farming inputs

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” está conformada por 12 socios emprendedores y trabajadores. Noymi de 50 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes lo cual le ha permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida. El deseo de Noymi es ampliar el volumen de sus productos llegando así a más clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar y harina.  El grupo “El Esfuerzo Es Grande” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Noymi se encuentra sentada en la parte frontal, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa marrón.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'El Esfuerzo Es Grande' [The Effort Is Great] consists of 12 enterprising and hardworking members.

Noymi of 50 years old is separated with 2 independent children. She works selling groceries which has enable her to have a better quality of life. Noymi hopes to increase the volume of her products and thereby reach more customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice, oil, sugar and flour.

The members of the 'El Esfuerzo Es Grande' group are grateful to the people who have made this loan possible and the commit to continue working well. 

Noymi is seated in the front, the second from the left wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Yohanna Danbaba

texts.en: Yohanna Danbaba is a 55-year-old farmer from Tudun Doka Danbasa. As a Babban Gona member, Yohanna Danbaba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yohanna Danbaba can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Yohanna Danbaba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 200 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yohanna Danbaba said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Hadiza, Alsheri, and Samaila, and in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 59 years old and married with four children. Jesusa works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jesusa has restarted her tailoring business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jesusa has taken a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jesusa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen de 39 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 2 años a su negocio que es una pulpería en su negocio vende: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, pollo, huevos, condimentos, libretas, etc.
Doña María del Carmen vive en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña María del Carmen está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, pan, leche, huevos, frutas y también quiere vender plásticos como vasos, platos, pailas, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es una cliente nueva con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su hija.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 39 years old, she lives with her daughter in her own home. For 2 years she has worked in a business which is a grocery store. In her business she sells rice, beans, sugar, butter, chicken, eggs, seasonings, notebooks, etc. 

Maria del Carmen lives in a community in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and she struggles from day to day to improve her quality of life.

Maria del Carmen is asking for the loan to purchase products such as: corn, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bead, milk, eggs, fruit and she also wants to sell plastic goods such as glasses, plates and buckets, etc. With the help of this loan she intends to improve her earnings and also her quality of life. She is a new client with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her customer base, at the same time improve her future with her daughter.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bead, milk, eggs, fruit, cups, plates and buckets.

loans.name: Adriel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Adriel se dedica al negocio de fabrica de chocolates,el socio vende chocolates desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de chocolates.El socio solicita el credito para comprar insumos para hacer chocolates como cacao y azucar.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank 'Los Amautas Pan de Azucar'. The bank is situated in the Echarate district, which belongs to La Convencion province, and the Cusco department.

Adriel works in a chocolate-making business. He sells chocolates from 8:00am to 6:00pm. The partner has been in this business for many years and it's going very well. The dream of this partner is to grow the chocolate selling business. This partner is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make chocolates such as cocoa and sugar.

The partner is happy with the loan and she commits to making the agreed payments.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make chocolates such as cocoa and sugar.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz es una personas trabajadora de 34 años de edad, Soltero, quien tiene cinco hijos, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad principal es la compra y venta de frutas (banano, zapote entre otros), a iniciado con el negocio hace cinco años, su hermano a aportado la experiencia principalmente en la comercialización, la venta lo realiza en los mercados regionales de su comunidad, donde es demando este tipo de frutas, así obtiene sus ganancias para ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para capital de trabajo y poder incrementar su mercadería. La meta que tiene con las ganancias del negocio, es ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y en un futuro verlos graduados.
texts.en: Cruz is a hard-working person, 34 years of age. He is single and has five children who live in the department of Sololá. His principal business activity is buying and selling fruits (bananas and zapote, among others). He began the business five years ago. His brother has supported the experiment, principally in the merchandising. He makes his sales in the regional markets of his community, where these types of fruit are in demand. Thus he obtains his earnings to help with the sustenance of his family. He is applying for a loan of 5000 quetzales for working capital and to be able to increase his merchandise. His goal for the earnings from the business is to help his children go to school and in the future to see them graduate.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 36 years old and married with three children.  With two of her children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Las Activas Del Sector C Group

texts.es:
Betty de 54 años de edad tiene cuatro hijos pertenece al grupo de Las Activas Del Sector C 
Que tiene un periodo de duración de dos años, tiene un negocio independiente de venta de abarrotes, condimentos, golosinas, etc, al cual le dedica 6 horas diarias y nos cuenta que le va muy bien y atiende 40 clientes al día, aparte de esto fabrica sobres para minerales, solicito el préstamo para invertir en la compra de golosinas, especerías y abarrotes en general. Se siente muy contenta de haber obtenido el préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo y pide sigan apoyando el deseo de superación de la gente que lo necesita.
texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old, she has four children and belongs to the Las Activas Del Sector C group.

For a two year period of duration, she has had an independent business selling groceries, condiments, soft drinks, etc, where she works 6 hours a day and tells us that it's going very well and she serves 40 customers a day. Apart from this she also makes packets for minerals. She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing soft drinks, spices and groceries in general.

She feels happy with having obtained the loan and she thanks the KIVA investors for the help and asks that they continue supporting the desire to improve themselves for the people who need it.

loans.use: to buy groceries and spices for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable him to do farming.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Joshua joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Sahabi, Naziru, and Salima. Joshua is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, as a result of this loan, Joshua will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Joshua can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14 and earn up to $2,000/hectare, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to use his anticipated income at the end of the season, Joshua said, “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland." Joshua is not thinking about just this year. He said, "In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina is 23 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Jina works very hard to provide for them.

Jina's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jina has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jina has taken a PHP 9,866 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of cashew nuts business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel proviene de un hogar de padres separados, vive en Lima junto a su madre y hermana, la cual es la única que aporta en los gastos de la casa trabajando como vendedora de modo estable ya que su madre es ama de casa y su padre no apoya con nada.
Miguel Angel trabaja de manera eventual manejando una mototaxi y con lo que gana paga sus gastos de movilidad hacia el instituto donde estudia mantenimiento de maquinaria pesada, carrera que espera poder concluir con ayuda de los prestamistas de Kiva y poder ser profesional. El tiene el sueño de culminar sus estudios y poder adquirir experiencia trabajando en una gran empresa para en un futuro poder abrir su propio taller que le permita ayudar a su madre y a su hermana.
Actualmente se encuentra a la mitad de su carrera y necesita del apoyo económico de los prestamistas de Kiva para poder culminarlos ya que no cuenta con los medios necesarios para poder solventarlos.
Miguel Angel esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva por ayudar a jóvenes talentosos como el a alcanzar sus sueños a través del acceso a la educación, ya que con esto están cambiando para mejor sus vidas.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel comes from a household with separated parents. He lives in Lima with his mother and his sister, who is the only one who supports the household expenses, working as a permanent salesperson, since his mother is a housewife and his father doesn't help with anything.

Miguel Angel works as a casual employee, driving a motorcycle taxi, and with what he earns, he pays his transportation expenses to the institute where he studies maintenance of heavy machinery, a course that he hopes to be able to complete with the help of the Kiva lenders to be able to become a professional. He has the dream of finishing his studies and being able to acquire experience working for a large business so that in the future he can open his own workshop, which will allow him to help his mother and his sister.

Now he is in the middle of his course and he needs the economic help of the Kiva lenders to be able to complete it, since he doesn't have the means necessary to be able to cover the costs.

Miguel Angel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping talented youth such as himself to reach their dreams through access to education, since with this they are changing their lives for the better.

loans.use: to finish his technical studies and achieve his dream of becoming a professional.

loans.name: Turagame Group

texts.fr:
Innocent fait partie du groupe Turagame et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 44 ans et est marié à  Gertrude, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 20 ans dont 5  étudient.

Il fait le commerce des  habits  depuis 2 ans.  

C’est son premier   crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et   acheter beaucoup d’habits   à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait avoir une maison  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Innocent is a part of the Turagame group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 44 years old and is married to Gertrude, a farmer. Together, they have 5 children aged between 3 and 20 years old, of which 5 are educated. He has sold clothes for two years. It is his first loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of clothes to resell at a profit. In the coming years, he would like to have a house and see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a lot of clothes to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Usman Ya'u

texts.en: Usman Ya'u remembers not being able to pay school fees or feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now Usman Ya'u, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize - more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Usman Ya'u is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed Usman Ya'u. With this loan, Usman Ya'u is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 58 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, etc.

Carmelita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like softdrinks, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ernesto Fidencio

texts.es: Ernesto  es un señor muy trabajador, el vive con su esposa y con sus 5 hijos de los cuales 2 asisten al colegio, con 54 años de edad Ernesto tienen bajos recursos económicos, Ernesto  se dedica al comercio de ganado y  también es  cabecilla o sea busca  más personas que se dediquen a jornal para juntarlos y luego busca donde pueden ir todos a trabajar,  Ernesto va a invertir el crédito en la compra de terneros, lo que aspira Ernesto es ganar algo más de dinero para arreglar su humilde casa que pudo construirla con ayuda del gobierno ecuatoriano, y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 54, is a very hardworking man.  He lives with his wife and his five children, two of whom attend school.  

Ernesto earns a living selling livestock.  He also is a crew leader: He recruits other people who work as day laborers and finds places for all of them to work together.

Ernesto's going to invest the loan in buying calves.  What he wants is to earn some more money to improve his children's quality of life and fix up his humble house that he managed to build with the help of the government of Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es una personas trabajadora de 39 años de edad, Soltero, quien tiene seis hijos, tres de ellos están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, quienes viven en el departamento de Sololá. Su actividad productiva es la compra y venta de Maxan (Hojas utilizadas para envoltura de alimentos), este negocio lo heredo de sus suegros hace cinco años, la venta lo realiza en los mercados regionales de su comunidad, del cual obtiene sus ingresos semanales, y que ha contribuido a mejorar la calidad de vida su familia. El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,500.00 para capital de trabajo para la compra y venta de hojas de Maxan y poder incrementar sus ventas. La meta a corto plazo es poder ver su producto en otros mercados regionales, e incrementar sus ventas con el propósito de mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel is a hard-working person, 39 years of age. He is single and has six children, three of whom go to school in the community. They live in the department of Sololá. His business activity is buying and selling maxan (leaves used to wrap foods). He inherited this business from his parents-in-law five years ago.
